The scope and coverage of the ontology result from the practical requirements of the realization of our knowledge graph and the associated concerns. An essential particularity of our domain is that we model perspectives rather than facts. Therefore, the possibilities of the linked open data paradigm to let complementary and also contradictory statements coexist are very useful to us. This particularity has the consequence that 'reification' (i.e., statements about statements) is an important modeling dimension that includes, among other things, the unambiguous referencing of each statement, including linkage to the dataset to which it can be traced.
20471.name: MiMoText Ontology

20473.description: iDAI.chronontology is a web service that combines concepts of time with dating. The ChronOntology project was funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG) from 2015 to 2018. The long-term availability of the data is guaranteed by the DAI as part of iDAI.welt.
20473.name: iDAI.chronontology

20474.description: ROR is a global, community-led registry of open persistent identifiers for research organizations
20474.name: Research Organization Registry

20475.description:
It is good practice for authors to acknowledge support for and contributions to their research in their published articles. This support may be financial, such as a grant or salary award; or practical, such as the use or loan of specialist facilities and equipment. They do this by listing the funding agency and the grant number somewhere in their article - usually the first or last page, or in the acknowledgments or footnotes section. Members contribute by depositing the funding acknowledgements from their publications as part of their standard metadata, together with the unique funder IDs listed in the OFR. The deposit should include funder names, funder IDs, and associated grant numbers.

This means that anyone can make connections, for example, to identify which funders invest in certain fields of research. Funding data is also used by funders to track the publications that result from their grants.
20475.name: Open Funder Registry

20476.description: This GRAPHIS Image Region vocabulary contains all concepts GRAPHIS currently provides its users to annotate image regions. Image regions are shapes like rectangles, circles or any possible polygon that can be marked and saved within an image. The IPTC Photo Metadata Standard (https://iptc.org/standards/photo-metadata/iptc-standard) has enabled storing these image regions since its 2019.1 version (see https://iptc.org/std/photometadata/specification/IPTC-PhotoMetadata#image-region, https://www.iptc.org/std/photometadata/specification/IPTC-PhotoMetadata-2019.1.html).
20476.name: GRAPHIS Image Region

20477.description:
The INDIGO Graffiti Thesaurus is a curated academic resource centred on contemporary graffiti terminology, with a spatial focus on the Danube Canal in Vienna, Austria. It is not just a compilation of terms, but also a specialised tool that organises and categorises graffiti-related concepts within a controlled vocabulary. More specifically, it takes the form of a thesaurus, where concepts are connected to each other through equivalence, hierarchical, and associative relationships.

By leveraging the Simple Knowledge Organization System (SKOS) data model, the thesaurus ensures consistency and precision in its representation of information. The use of SKOS not only makes the thesaurus accessible but also interoperable, allowing for seamless integration with other widely used resources such as Wikidata and the Getty Art & Architecture Thesaurus (AAT) of the J. Paul Getty Trust and Getty Research Institute. The thesaurus is inspired by the AAT and therefore also contains information provided under the ODC Attribution License by the Getty Research Institute. Moreover, the content systematically reflects the structure of the AAT by using facets, hierarchy names, and guide terms.

The thesaurus is made available through the Vocabs service of the Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH), which utilises Skosmos, an open-source software tailored for publishing vocabularies. For enhanced accessibility, the thesaurus can be queried via a REST API (Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interface), facilitating its interaction with data over the World Wide Web. Moreover, its availability in diverse data formats, including TSV (Tab-Separated Values) and JSON (JavaScript Object Notation), caters to a wide range of academic and technological preferences.

With its unique focus on the graffiti culture of the Danube Canal, the thesaurus offers a deep insight into Vienna's Danube Canal contemporary graffiti world and serves as a valuable tool for all those interested in this form of creativity.
20477.name: INDIGO Graffiti Thesaurus

20478.description: List of archaeological periods & ages for cultural heritage use in Scotland.
20478.name: ScAPA : Scottish Archaeological Periods & Ages

20479.description: The type of ownership or legal status of property of an object in the collection, e.g. property, loan, or foreign property etc.
20479.name: Status of property (MK Berlin)

20480.description: The owner of the collection in question.
20480.name: Owner (MK Berlin)

20481.description: The weight of a (numismatic) object. This is usually given in grams (g), usually with one decimal place, more rarely with two decimal places.
20481.name: Weight

20482.description: The technique of manufacture, e.g. struck or cast.
20482.name: Manufacture (MK Berlin)

20483.description: A notable, characteristic or unusual physical feature of an individual numismatic object which distinguishes it from other examples of the same group, or of a group of numismatic objects that marks it out from other groups, and which is related to the process of production of a numismatic object.
20483.name: Peculiarity of production (MK Berlin)

20484.description: A corporation, public or private, which is related to an object in the collection.
20484.name: Corporation (MK Berlin)

20485.description: A modern state or country to which certain regions, places (as mints, places of issue for paper money), and find places are being assigned to.
20485.name: Country (MK Berlin)

20486.description: The physical material from which an object is made.
20486.name: Material (MK Berlin)

20487.description: The legal status of the person, ethnic, or institutional authority under which any numismatic object is issued. This term can be described more closely at a secondary level (Archbishopric - Archbishopric Cologne, Swiss Federation - Canton of Graubünden etc.).
20487.name: Class/status (MK Berlin)

20488.description: Term indicating the value of a coin or banknote within a certain denominational system.
20488.name: Denomination (MK Berlin)

20489.description: Term to describe the physical status of an object, e.g. present, damaged, lost, stolen...
20489.name: Object status (MK Berlin)

20490.description: The location or place, in which a coin was minted, paper money issued or an object found.
20490.name: Location (MK Berlin)

20491.description: A period in time and in the history of humans, also used here to categorizing certain periods in art history.
20491.name: Period (MK Berlin)

20492.description: Any individual in his or her relationship or role to an object in question.
20492.name: Person (MK Berlin)

20493.description: A region either historic or contemporary within a modern state.
20493.name: Region (MK Berlin)

20494.description: The type of a numismatic object, e.g. coin, medal, token etc.
20494.name: Item (MK Berlin)

20495.description: Any features which arise subsequent to the actual production of a numismatic object; for example halving, chop-marking, etc.
20495.name: Secondary Treatment (MK Berlin)

20496.description: The relationship between the orientation of obverse and reverse of a (struck) coin or medal. Often expressed as hours of the clock (from 1 to 12 h) or degrees in a circle.
20496.name: Die-axis (MK Berlin)

20497.description: Term to describe the role of an individual or corporation regarding a numismatic object, e.g. authority, sitter, previous owner etc.
20497.name: Type for person and corporation (MK Berlin)

20498.description: A website, portal or digital resource which either represents a database to browse a certain collection or allows for a systematic presentation of types or concepts in relation to individual numismatic objects.
20498.name: Type of Source (MK Berlin)

20499.description: A system of monetary units in common use, issued by a state, city, or any other legal authority, consisting of various subunits and multiples (denominations).
20499.name: Currency (MK Berlin)

205.name: School of the Freudian Cause Thesaurus

2050.description: In a Pokémon's Pokédex information, the category (...) (Japanese: 分類 classification) is a name which identifies the Pokémon based on one of its defining biological characteristics. Most often, the defining traits are part of the Pokémon’s physiology, special abilities, or behavior. It was previously also known as species. (...) Because of how brief and uninformative the description of a Pokémon often is in its category, and how little the category relates to other data, it is not often regarded as an important piece of information about a Pokémon. Before Generation III, the category was shown by just seeing the Pokémon, rather than upon catching it. In Pokémon games prior to Generation III, the character limit for a category name was ten characters. This has since increased from Generation III onwards, with the longest English category name being observed to be thirteen characters long. In other languages, the longest category name is Pachirisu's German category 'Elektrohörnchen' which is 15 characters long. This includes spaces but does not include 'Pokémon'.
2050.name: Pokémon Category

20500.description: The type of accession of an object into the collection: e.g. purchased, donated etc.
20500.name: Accession (MK Berlin)

20501.description: A vocabulary for all areas of catalysis initiated in NFDI4Cat. Starting with photocatalysis we add more and more terms from other areas of catalysis and related disciplines like chemical engineering or materials science.
20501.name: voc4cat

20502.description:
Thesaurus for the identification and description of elements of architecture.
Connections with the terms used in the AAT and Royal Commission on the
Historical Monuments of England1.
Specific for art and art history area.
Managed by the Ministry of Culture and Communication (MCC/DAPA)
Used as an internal index and information retrieval tool for the national
heritage databases (Mémoire, Mérimée, P alissy)
20502.name: Architecture Thesaurus

20503.description: The Allgemeines Künstlerlexikon (AKL) is a name authority file. Designed as International Database of Artists.
20503.name: Artists of the world

20504.description: Through the multilingual MICHAEL service you can find and explore digital collections from museums, archives, libraries and other cultural institutions from across Europe. Whether you are interested in art or archaeology, family history or planning holidays, the Romans or modern History, MICHAEL can show you what is available.
20504.name: Multilingual Inventory of Cultural Heritage in Europe

20505.description: The terminological tool presented here constitutes a reworking, edited by the ICCU and the VAST-LAB Laboratory within the framework of the EU project ARIADNE (Advanced Research Infrastructure for Archaeological Dataset Networking in Europe), of the standard thesaurus released by the ICCD for the definition of movable archaeological property, functional for the compilation of the RA - Archaeological Finds catalog card, for which please refer to the institutional page http://www.iccd.beniculturali.it/index.php?it/473/standard-catalografici/Standard/74.
20505.name: Thesaurus Archaeological Finds

20506.description: The DiGA Thesaurus is a resource for the standard description of Gandharan Buddhist art. It draws upon the “Repertorio terminologico per la schedatura delle sculture dell’arte gandharica” published by Domenico Faccenna and Anna Filigenzi in 2007 (IsIAO, Rome). This printed resource has been revised, expanded and restructured to fit a digital use. It now covers the following categories: animals, architecture, ceremonial objects, decorative motifs, everyday objects, figures (general features), figures (protagonists), means of transports, musical instruments, narratives, the sculptor's work, vegetation, weapons. Concerning the new categories of ‘narratives’ and ‘figures’, these are based on a variety of complementary sources.
20506.name: The Digitization of Gandharan Artefacts Thesaurus

20507.description: The DiGA Gazetteer is a resource for the standard description of Gandharan Buddhist art.
20507.name: The Digitization of Gandharan Artefacts Gazetteer

20508.description: This concept scheme contains skos concepts for analysis methods used to produce observation results with information about the physical properties, chemical or isotopic composition, crystallography, or molecular structure of material samples. Based on spreadsheet compilation of method vocabularies from Geo.X, GEOROC, PetDB and OSIRIS-REx. Definitions added and updated based on web research, and SKOS serialization by S.M. Richard. Note that although there are high-level method categories for 'Physical property measurement', 'Geochronology technique',  and 'Bioanalytical method', these are placeholders and only include a few examples that are relevant to analytical methods in geo- or cosmochemistry.
20508.name: Analytical methods for geochemistry and cosmochemistry

20509.description: CHMO, the chemical methods ontology, describes methods used to collect data in chemical experiments, such as mass spectrometry and electron microscopy prepare and separate material for further analysis, such as sample ionisation, chromatography, and electrophoresis synthesise materials, such as epitaxy and continuous vapour deposition It also describes the instruments used in these experiments, such as mass spectrometers and chromatography columns. It is intended to be complementary to the Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI).
20509.name: Chemical Methods Ontology

20510.description: The Semantic Web for Earth and Environmental Terminology is a mature foundational ontology that contains over 6000 concepts organized in 200 ontologies represented in OWL. Top level concepts include Representation (math, space, science, time, data), Realm (Ocean, Land Surface, Terrestrial Hydroshere, Atmosphere, etc.), Phenomena (macro-scale ecological and physical), Processes (micro-scale physical, biological, chemical, and mathematical), Human Activities (Decision, Commerce, Jurisdiction, Environmental, Research). Originally developed by NASA Jet Propulsion Labs under Rob Raskin, SWEET is now officially under the governance of the ESIP foundation.
20510.name: Semantic Web for Earth and Environment Technology Ontology

20511.description: The Thesaurus of Archaeological Terminology is a web thesaurus aimed at making the terminology of archaeology and the related disciplines more available. TEATER is intended for a wide sphere of users ranging from the lay public to amateur archaeologists, beginning students of archaeology, librarians of not only archaeological institutions and professional archaeologists. The entries are available in an interactive interface that enables both full-text searching and hierarchical browsing. TEATER’s content is available in three language versions – Czech, English and German. Entries can be exported from TEATER in .json format or linked using their PURL. More information on the possibilities of use of the thesaurus by various groups of users, the search application, the structure and selection of the entries is available in the Help section.
20511.name: Thesaurus of Archaeological Terminology

20514.description:
The SPDX License List is an integral part of the SPDX Specification. The SPDX License List itself is a list of commonly found licenses and exceptions used in free and open or collaborative software, data, hardware, or documentation. The SPDX License List includes a standardized short identifier, the full name, the license text, and a canonical permanent URL for each license and exception.

The purpose of the SPDX License List is to enable efficient and reliable identification of such licenses and exceptions in an SPDX document, in source files or elsewhere.
20514.name: SPDX License List

20515.description: mimetype.io is an open-source Gatsby-based project that provides a comprehensive database and resources related to various MIME types.
20515.name: MIME types

20516.description: Persons and institutions of the german vocabulary of museum-digital.
20516.name: md:term Persons and Institutions

20517.description: Geographic terms of the german vocabulary of museum-digital.
20517.name: md:term places

20518.description: Terms concerning times of the german vocabulary of museum-digital.
20518.name: md:term Times

20519.description: Tags of the german vocabulary of museum-digital.
20519.name: md:term tags

20520.description: A complete revision of the first veterinary glossary published in 2006 jointly by the Korean Veterinary Society and the Korean Veterinary Society. English-Korean Veterinary Terms and Korean-English Veterinary Terms are included. From 2013 to 2015, the research was conducted by the support of the service research project of the Agriculture, Forestry and Livestock Quarantine Headquarters, 'Project for Standardization of Veterinary Terms and Publishing of Glossary (Research Project Management No. Z-154174502013-15-01). For veterinary terms, pet, animal behavior, horse-related terms, general names of various animals, scientific names, parasites, bacteria, viruses, food science terms, livestock idioms, and veterinary education were inserted based on recent data.
20520.name: Veterinary Terminology : English-Korean·Korean-English

20521.description: Based on the terms used in LCD, PDP, OLED, and FED, it was intended to unify the definition of terms compared to IEC International Standard Terminology, to unify a total of 777 terms by elaborating on different definitions of one term, and to help understand by creating an appendix for additional explanations of backlight, photometry, color temperature, and correlation color temperature.
20521.name: Display Standard Terms

20522.description: Legal terms used in intellectual property lawsuits were reviewed to present appropriate English translations for Korean terms and appropriate Korean translations for English terms, and explanations and use cases for terms were added to Korean and English so that domestic and foreign judgments and materials could be translated and understood easily and accurately.
20522.name: Intellectual Property Law Dictionary

20523.description:
The Shoulder and Elbow Terminology is an online glossary provided by the Korean Shoulder and Elbow Society. It offers not only shoulder and elbow terminology but also recommended terms, information from the 4th edition of the Korean Medical Terminology, and the 2nd edition of the Orthopedic Terminology.
The shoulder joint is a joint that extends from the shoulder to the elbow, and it is intended to help understand the basic and overall contents of shoulder joint and subjective anatomy, one of the most active clinical and basic research areas in the orthopedic field.
20523.name: Shoulder and Elbow Terminology

20524.description: Types of golf courses classified by the Sports Facilities Act. The golf course business is one of the registered sports facility businesses, and is divided into membership golf course business and non-membership golf course business. Among non-membership golf courses, golf courses that meet requirements such as usage fees may be designated as public golf courses as prescribed by Presidential Decree.
20524.name: Golf course classification system

20525.description:
New patent classification system related to the 4th Industrial Revolution The previous seven technical fields related to the 4th Industrial Revolution* were expanded and improved to 16 technical fields** and added to the advanced patent classification (CPC) system. Details may be partially revised during the international standardization and revision process.

* Artificial intelligence (AI), big data, cloud, Internet of Things (IoT), intelligent robots, autonomous vehicles, 3D printing

** Artificial intelligence (AI), big data, cloud computing, next-generation communications, Internet of Things (IoT), intelligent robots, autonomous vehicles, drones, virtual augmented reality, smart cities, customized healthcare, innovative new drugs, intelligent semiconductors, advanced materials, renewable energy, 3D printing
20525.name: New patent classification system

20526.description: The April Revolution Term Dictionary is a term dictionary provided by the April Revolution Web Dictionary, which was piloted by the Democratic Movement Memorial Society, and provides slogans, synonyms, and related words for the April Revolution. In addition, the April Revolution Web Dictionary provides information such as concepts and definitions, backgrounds and causes, the development of events, major events, historical significance, and the status of commemorative succession.
20526.name: April Revolution

20527.description: AR-VR industry classification is a classification system used for the "Virtual Augmented Reality (VR/AR) Industry Survey" of national approval statistics issued by the Software Policy Research Institute. The VR and AR industries are largely classified into four categories: "content production and supply business," "content sales and service business," "dedicated equipment, equipment and parts manufacturing business," and "dedicated software development and supply business.
20527.name: AR•VR Industry Classification

20528.description: The ICT R&D technology classification system was created in consideration of technology trends and support fields in the ICT field to efficiently promote the planning, evaluation, and management of R&D projects under Article 3 of the Information and Communication and Broadcast R&D Management Regulations.
20528.name: ICT R&D Technology Classification

20529.description: KIAST Terminology Dictionary provided by KIAST Aviation Safety Technology Institute. Data are provided by dividing into fields, terms (Korean), terms (English), and explanations. As of August 19, 2024, 115 terms can be searched.
20529.name: Korea Institute of Aviation Safety Technology Glossary

2053.description:
The Virtual International Authority File (VIAF) is an international service designed to provide convenient access to the world's major name authority files. Its creators envision the VIAF as a building block for the Semantic Web to enable switching of the displayed form of names for persons to the preferred language and script of the Web user. VIAF began as a joint project with the Library of Congress (LC), the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek (DNB), the Bibliothèque nationale de France (BNF) and OCLC. It has, over the past decade, become a cooperative effort involving an expanding number of other national libraries and other agencies. (...)

VIAF helps to make library authority files less expensive to maintain and more generally useful to the library domain and beyond. To achieve this, VIAF matches and links the authority files of national libraries and groups all authority records for a given entity into a merged 'super' authority record that brings together the different names for that entity. By linking disparate names for the same person or organization, VIAF provides a convenient means for a wider community of libraries and other agencies to repurpose bibliographic data produced by libraries serving different language communities.
2053.name: Virtual International Authority File

20530.description: The classification of the national job competency standard represents the step-by-step composition of the national job competency standard based on the type of job, and is classified by referring to the Korean Employment Classification of Occupations (KECO). It consists of 'large categories (24), → middle categories (81), → small categories (273), → subdivisions (1,093).
20530.name: Classification of National Competency Standards

20531.description: The term livestock infectious disease [classification system] means a disease defined in subparagraph 2 of Article 2 of the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act (hereinafter referred to as the "Act"), which means type 1 livestock infectious disease, type 2 livestock infectious disease, and type 3 livestock infectious disease. In subparagraph 2 (b) of Article 2 of the Act and subparagraph 2 (c) of Article 2 of the Act, "communicable diseases of livestock prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs" is prescribed in Article 2 (1) and (2) of the Enforcement Rules of the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act.
20531.name: Classification system for livestock infectious diseases

20533.description: Classification of materials used in KENOM portal.
20533.name: KENOM Material

20534.description: The Berklee MHI Taxonomy is designed to empower researchers, clinicians, and practitioners in the field of music and health by providing a structured, hierarchical system for categorizing and accessing relevant studies. It serves as a tool to facilitate the identification of quality evidence, enabling users to effectively compare and contrast various studies, build upon existing research, and identify gaps within the literature. By organizing information into distinct sections encompassing both medical and music-related terms, the taxonomy allows for comprehensive searches across a wide range of categories, including conditions, procedures, outcomes, interventions, and more. This systematic approach supports the development of a robust evidence base, essential for establishing the legitimacy of music as a complementary treatment in the medical community.
20534.name: Berklee Music and Health Institute Taxonomy

20535.description: Financial term is financial terminology and explanatory information provided by the Financial Services Commission, and keyword search and alphabetical search can be performed.
20535.name: Financial Term

20536.description: List of all types for the Historic Geo Information System (https://bartoc.org/en/node/20435).
20536.name: GOV: List of all types

20537.description: Multilingual terminology extracted from "Conseil international des archives, Comité de sigillographie, Vocabulaire international de la Sigillographie, Roma, Ministero per i beni culturali e ambientali. Ufficio centrale per i beni archivistici, 1990 (Pubblicazioni degli archivi di Stato, Sussidi, 3)., which is online at http://www.archivi.beniculturali.it/dga/uploads/documents/Sussidi/Sussidi_3_A.pdf.

20538.description:
Codicologica is an online application providing a multilingual vocabulary for the scholarly description of manuscripts. It aims at being a tool for all manuscript catalogers, text editors and everyone interested in historical manuscripts."
"It provides a list of terms in French, with their definitions, and for most of them their English, Italian, and Spanish equivalents. Codicologia also offers a list of terms in Arabic with their definitions. Codicologia also provides a rich iconography and pedagogical explanations, which are not retrieved in this present ontology.

20539.description: This site is an online version of the Vocabulaire international de la diplomatique, ed. Maria Milagros Cárcel Ortí, 2. ed., Valéncia 1997 (Collecció Oberta), which the Commission Internationale de Diplomatique assembled and the Universitat de València put to print.

20540.description:
These licenses conform to the Open Definition and are:

Reusable: Not specific to an organization or jurisdiction.
Compatible: Must be compatible with at least one of GPL-3.0+, CC-BY-SA-4.0, and ODbL-1.0. Permissive/attribution-only licenses must be compatible with all 3 of the aforementioned licenses, and at least one of Apache-2.0, CC-BY-4.0, and ODC-BY-1.0.
Current: Widely used and generally considered best practice by a broad spectrum of projects and actors within the domains of applicability of the license."
20540.name: Open Definition License List

20541.description: German Research Foundation (DFG) classification of scientific disciplines, research areas, review boards, and subject areas for 2016-2019. The vocabulary is reviewed by the Senate of the DFG every four years (2016-2019, 2020-2024, ...)
20541.name: Systematics of the subjects and colleges of the German Research Association (2016-2019)

20542.description: German Research Foundation (DFG) classification of scientific disciplines, research areas, review boards, and subject areas for 2020-2024. The vocabulary is reviewed by the Senate of the DFG every four years (2016-2019, 2020-2024, ...)
20542.name: Systematics of the subjects and colleges of the German Research Association (2020-2024)

20544.description: Classification of aptitudes required for military service is an aptitude classification guideline applied to give appropriate 兵科 in addition to physical examination. The Military Manpower Administration classifies aptitude necessary for military service based on the results of military service examination and individual qualification, major, and career, and detailed criteria are determined according to the Presidential Decree and the guidelines for classifying aptitude.
20544.name: Classification of aptitudes required for military service

20545.description: The Classification System for each type of construction waste is divided into those that can and cannot burn construction waste, and is stipulated in Article 3-2 and attached Table 1 of the Enforcement Rules of the same Act in accordance with Article 12 of the Act on the Promotion of Recycling of Construction Waste.
20545.name: Classification system for each type of construction waste

20546.description:
The Shoulder and Elbow Dictionary is a glossary on shoulder and elbow joints published by the Korean Association of Dogs and Joints. It published the first edition in 2008 and the second edition in 2018. Both the first and second editions were issued without receiving an International Standard Book Number (ISBN), and in the case of the second edition, the original text was downloaded from the website of the Korean Association of Dogs and Joints, but as a result of confirmation on September 4, 2024, the original text is not currently provided.


Contents of the 2nd edition of the Glossary of Subjective Anthropology of the shoulder joint

Since the publication of the first edition of the glossary in 2008, progress has been made in the field of shoulder and main joint studies, especially with the emergence of terms due to changes in new diagnosis and treatment techniques, a clearer and more detailed arrangement is needed. In order to add and unify terms related to diagnosis and treatment techniques that have changed over the past decade, Professor Kim Yoo-jin was able to publish the second edition through the hard work of the term compilation committee members such as Kim Jae-yoon, Moon Sung-hoon, Lee Doo-hyung, Jeong Seok-won, and Hyun Yoon-seok. This glossary, newly published in 2018, was based on two editions of the shoulder joint textbook, and more than 300 terms were updated and added to reflect the changed academic development over the past decade, and the terms that have been mixed were unified and described.
20546.name: Shoulder and Elbow Dictionary

20547.description: The List of Wooden tables by historical site is a list of wooden items that were registered on the website of the National Gaya Cultural Research Institute's "Ancient Mokgan" (currently National Heritage Knowledge > Research DB > Ancient Mokgan) by ruins. A total of 512 wooden items excavated from 22 historical sites are registered. The list was not only excavated from Haman Seongsan Mountain, but also from all over the country, and provides basic information on the land, shape, and size of the wooden items, as well as image and drawings.
20547.name: List of wooden tablets by historical site

20548.description:
The Korea Performing Arts box office information system classification standards are the criteria for establishing an integrated computer network for performing arts and classifying facilities used in statistics operated by the Arts Management Support Center. The KOPIS Big Data Contest has been held every year since 2021, and when posting a post related to the contest in the notice, the preliminary briefing materials, the KOPIS genre classification system, and the KOPIS facility characteristics classification criteria are uploaded together, which can be checked in the post.

*The Korea Performing Arts box office information system (KOPIS) is a system that provides accurate and reliable performance information and statistical services by aggregating distributed performance ticket reservation/cancellation information.


1. Post of notice confirming the criteria for classification of characteristics of the integrated computer network of performing arts by year

KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - Classification of Facilities Characteristics of the 2021 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network (Attachment: [Reference] Classification of Characteristics and Genre Classification System of KOPIS Facilities)
KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - Classification of Facilities Characteristics of the 2022 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network (Attachment: [Reference] Classification of Characteristics and Genre Classification System of KOPIS Facilities)
KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - 2023 Characteristics Classification of Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network Facilities (Attachment: [Reference 3] Criteria for classification of characteristics of KOPIS facilities)
KOPIS Integrated Performing Arts Network - 2024 Classification of Facilities Characteristics of Integrated Performing Arts Network (Attachment: 4. KOPIS Column Definition. Genre Classification and Facility Characteristics Classification Criteria Definition)
(2021-2023 Same, 2024 Variation (Other-Overseas-etc, etc.)
20548.name: Korea Performing arts box office Information System - Facility Characteristics Classification Standards

20549.description:
The Korea Performing Arts box office information system Genre Classification System is a classification system for each genre used in the establishment and statistics of the performing arts integrated computer network operated by the Arts Management Support Center. The KOPIS Big Data Contest has been held every year since 2021 by the Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network*, and when posting a post related to the contest in the notice, the preliminary briefing materials, the KOPIS genre classification system, and the criteria for classifying KOPIS facilities are uploaded together, which can be checked in the post.

*The Korea Performing Arts box office information system (KOPIS) is a system that provides accurate and reliable performance information and statistical services by aggregating distributed performance ticket reservation/cancellation information.


1. Post of notice to check the classification system of each genre of the integrated computer network for performing arts by year

KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - 2021 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network Genre Classification System (Attachment: [Reference] KOPIS Facility Characteristics Classification and Genre Classification System)
KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - 2022 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network Genre Classification System (Attachment: [Reference] KOPIS Facility Characteristics Classification and Genre Classification System)
KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - 2023 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network Genre Classification System (Attachment: [Reference 3] Criteria for classifying KOPIS facilities)
KOPIS Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network - 2024 Performing Arts Integrated Computer Network genre classification system (attached file: 4. KOPIS column definition book. definition book for classification of genre and facility characteristics)

2. Organization of Integrated Computer Network for Performing Arts

The operating institution of the integrated performing arts network shall be designated every three years and notified in the official gazette (designated and notified as an institution dedicated to the operation of the integrated performing arts network) pursuant to Article 3 (2) of the Enforcement Decree of the Performing Arts Act.

Designation and notification of an institution dedicated to the operation of the integrated computer network for performing arts (administrative rules)
National Legal Information Center: Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism Notification No. 2020-20
National Legal Information Center: Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism Notification No. 2023-21
20549.name: Korea Performing arts box office Information System Genre Classification System

2055.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Configuration Types or Categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge that are specifically associated with 'Configurations' and Configuration Management. Such information is often used as a foundation for work that needs to be performed as well as data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.
2055.name: Configuration Taxonomy

20550.description:
The Classification of Scientific and Technological Materials is a classification of scientific and technological data collected, investigated, studied, preserved, and exhibited in the Science Museum, and is stipulated in Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Act on the Establishment, Operation, and Promotion of Science Museums.



1. Act on the Establishment, Operation, and Fostering of Science Museum (abbreviated as Science Museum Act)

[Enforcement May 28, 2024] [Act No. 20353, February 27, 2024, Partial Amendment]

Article 2 (Definition) The meanings of terms used in this law are as follows. <Amendment December 24, 2018>
1. The term "science museum" means a facility that collects, investigates, and researches science and technology data, preserves and exhibits them, and distributes science and technology knowledge by opening various science and technology education programs, and meets the requirements for registration, such as science and technology data and professional staff under Article 6 (1).
2. The term "science and technology data" means data on basic science, applied science, industrial technology, science and technology history, and other data prescribed by Presidential Decree, which have historical and educational value in science and technology.
[Professional revision June 7, 2011]



2. Enforcement Decree of the Act on the Establishment, Operation, and Fostering of Science Museums (abbreviated as the Enforcement Decree of the Science Museum Act)

[Enforcement on August 9, 2022] [Presidential Decree No. 32868, August 9, 2022, amendment of other laws]

The term "data prescribed by Presidential Decree" in subparagraph 2 of Article 2 (hereinafter referred to as the "Act") of the Act on the Establishment, Operation, and Fostering of Science Museum (hereinafter referred to as the "Act") means data intended to induce understanding and interest in science and technology by using facilities, video media, etc.
Article 3 (classification of science and technology data) Science and technology data under subparagraph 2 of Article 2 of the Act shall be classified as shown in attached Table 1.
[Professional revision April 22, 2013]
20550.name: Classification of Scientific and Technological Materials

20551.description: The Special Account for Educational Expense aims to prescribe standards for accounting and financial statement reporting for special accounting for educational expenses, and presents the classification of liabilities, assets, profits, and costs.
20551.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses

20552.description:
Special Account for Educational Expense: Classification of Liabilities is a classification of the types of current obligations that are expected to leak resources in the future for the implementation of the obligations, i.e., obligations borne by metropolitan and provincial offices of education as a result of past transactions or events.


1. Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses
[Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]

Article 17 (Definition and Recognition Criteria of Debt) Debt refers to the current obligation that is expected to leak resources in the future for the implementation of obligations borne by metropolitan and provincial offices of education as a result of past transactions or events.
② Debt is recognised when economic benefits are likely to be leaked to meet current obligations and the amount can be reliably measured.

Article 18 (classification of liabilities) ① Liabilities are classified into current liabilities, long-term borrowings and other non-current liabilities.
② Current liabilities are liabilities that must be repaid within one year after the end of the fiscal year, and refer to deposits, unpaid payments, short-term loans, and long-term liquidity liabilities.
③ Long-term borrowing liabilities refer to long-term borrowing, local bonds, and private-interest liabilities that must be repaid in excess of one year after the end of the fiscal year among liabilities arising from borrowing transactions.
④ Other non-current liabilities are liabilities that do not belong to current liabilities and long-term borrowing liabilities, such as retirement benefit provision liabilities, rental deposits, and long-term advance income.
20552.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses:Classification of Liabilities

20553.description:
Special Account for Educational Expense: Classification of Liabilities is a major functional classification of net asset reduction arising from the use or outflow of economic benefits through the consumption of goods or services, etc., as defined in the special account for educational expenses.


1. Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses

[Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]

Article 24 (Definition and Recognition of Costs) ① Cost refers to a decrease in net assets arising from the use or outflow of economic benefits from the consumption of goods or services during the fiscal year. However, the cost does not include the decrease in net assets caused by the transfer of property between accounting and the conversion of goods under the jurisdiction of goods. <Amendment 2023. 3. 3.> ② The criteria for recognizing costs are as follows.

Expenses such as salaries, payment fees, rent fees, and repair maintenance expenses incurred in return benefits are recognized when the provision of goods or services is over and the amount can be reliably measured.
Expenses such as subsidies and donations incurred without counter benefits are recognized when an obligation to transfer value exists and the amount can be reliably measured.
Article 25 (classification of costs) Expenses are classified by major functions such as human resource management, teaching and learning activities support, educational welfare, and health meals. 
<Amendment on June 25, 2015, March 3, 2023>
20553.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses:Classification of Costs

20554.description:
Special Account for Educational Expense: Classification of Revenue is a classification of income defined in the Special Account for Educational Expenses, that is, an increase in net assets arising from the inflow of economic benefits through the provision of goods or services during the fiscal year, donation, etc., according to the source of financing.


1. Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses

[Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]

Article 22 (Definition and Recognition of Profits) ① Revenue refers to the increase in net assets arising from the inflow of economic benefits through the provision of goods or services, donation, etc. during the fiscal year. However, the increase in net assets resulting from the transfer of property between accounting under Article 12 of the Public Property and Commodity Management Act (hereinafter referred to as "transfer of property between accounting") and the conversion of goods under Article 63 of the same Act (hereinafter referred to as "transfer of goods") shall not be included in the revenue. <Amendment 2023. 3. 3.> ② The criteria for recognizing profits are as follows.

Revenue such as user fees and fees arising from the provision of goods or services is recognized when the revenue generation activity is over and the amount can be reliably measured.
Revenues such as grants and subsidies generated without counter benefits are recognized when the right to claim the revenue occurs and the amount can be reliably measured.
Article 23 (classification of revenue) Revenue is classified as follows, depending on the source of financing.

Self-revenue: Revenue raised by the Metropolitan/Do Office of Education through its own activities to provide goods or services or through its own collection activities
Transfer income: Income transferred by the accounting entity from the State, local governments, etc. without any counter-benefits
Other Earnings: Earnings other than No. 1 and No. 2 [Full Story Revision March 3, 2023]
20554.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses:Classification of Revenue

20555.description:
Special Account for Educational Expenses: Classification of Net Worth refers to the net assets defined in the special account for educational expenses, that is, the remaining amount of assets minus liabilities, and is classified as fixed net assets, specific net assets and general net assets.


1. Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses
[Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]


Article 19 (Definition and Classification of Net Assets) ① Net assets refer to the remaining amount of assets minus liabilities and are classified as fixed net assets, specific net assets and general net assets.
② Fixed net assets shall be the amount of investment in tangible assets minus long-term borrowings, local bonds, and private lease liabilities raised for the purpose of providing investment resources for the facility.
③ A specific net asset means a reserve for which the purpose of use is specified, such as repayment of debts and improvement of old facilities, etc., and the reserve shall be deposited and managed separately according to the relevant purpose.
④ General net assets refer to the amount of net assets excluding fixed net assets and specific net assets.
20555.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses:Classification of Net Worth

20556.description:
Special Account for Educational Expense: Classification of Assets is the classification of assets defined in the Special Account for Educational Expenses, that is, resources currently owned or controlled by metropolitan and provincial offices of education as a result of past transactions or events and expected to generate economic benefits in the future.


1. Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses
[Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]


Article 10 (Definition and Recognition Criteria of Assets) ① An asset refers to a resource that is currently owned or controlled by the metropolitan and provincial offices of education as a result of past transactions or events and is expected to generate economic benefits in the future.
② Assets are recognized when they contribute to educational and artistic activities or when future economic benefits are likely to flow into metropolitan and provincial offices of education, and the amount can be reliably measured.

Article 11 (classification of assets) ① Assets are classified into current assets, investment assets, tangible assets, intangible assets and other non-current assets.
② Delete <June 25, 2015>

Article 12 (Current Assets) Liquid assets refer to cash and cash equivalents, short-term financial instruments, unpaid bonds, unpaid loans, short-term loans, advance payments and inventory assets that can be cashed or are expected to be realized within one year after the end of the fiscal year.

Article 13 (Investment Asset) Investment assets refer to long-term financial products, long-term investment securities, and long-term loans held for the purpose of investment or exercise of rights.

Article 14 (Tangible Asset) Tangible assets refer to assets used repeatedly or continuously for more than one year in educational and academic affairs, such as land, buildings, structures, educational and research equipment, machinery, books, furniture, vehicle transportation hemisphere, standing trees, museum relics, and assets under construction.

Article 15 (Intangible Asset) Intangible assets are rights that can be used exclusively and exclusively for a certain period of time, including industrial property rights, copyrights, software and software development costs.

Article 16 (Other Non-current Assets) Other non-current assets are assets that do not belong to the assets under Articles 12 through 15 and refer to long-term unpaid payments, deposits, long-term advance payments, and long-term advance expenses.
20556.name: Special Account for Educational Expenses:Classification of Assets

20557.description: The National Pathogen Resource List is a list of pathogen resources surveyed pursuant to Article 6 of the ⌋ on the Promotion of Collection, Management and Utilization of ⌈ Pathogen Resources ('National Pathogen Resource Status Survey') and is prepared every five years. Information such as resource number, resource name, resource classification (resource type), and biosafety level is provided, and information possessed by each resource is different.
20557.name: National Pathogen Resource List

20558.description: The National Science and Technology Standard Classification System is a national standard classification framework for information management and distribution, efficient human resource management, and efficient planning and management of R&D projects in the field of science and technology, and is an independent two-dimensional classification system for research and application fields. The research field is a three-tier classification system, consisting of 33 major categories, 369 subcategories, and 2,899 subcategories, and the application field is a one-tier classification system, consisting of 32 major categories.
20558.name: National Science and Technology Standard Classification System

20559.description:
The Korea National Insect List is a list of insect species living in Korea that standardizes the names of confusingly used or misrepresented insects, minimizes errors, and organizes them.

<The most basic process of insect taxonomy>

The taxonomy and cataloguing of species is the most fundamental process of insect taxonomy.

The completion of a standardized and unified list of insects living in Korea (scientific and national names) is an indispensable element of systematic national insect resource management. However, insect names are determined by the results of research in insect taxonomy, and there are also insect names that have not been clearly defined in accordance with ongoing research on insects, along with international conventions based on the Latin scientific method of selection. The names of insects known so far are also incorrectly recorded due to differences in interpretation, causing some problems.

The National List of Insects is a list of insect species living in Korea that standardizes the names of these confusingly used or misrepresented insects, minimizes errors, and compiles them.

The national standard insect list is continuously managed by reflecting the latest data on the insect name, and it will be provided to download it in the form of attached files on the Internet through central database work. As a result, the list of insects prepared across all fields related to general insects, including government ministries, related research institutes, and educational institutions, can be used
20559.name: Korea Insect Names Index

2056.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of the different Configuration Item types that are tracked and managed as part of the Configuration Management discipline and its related set of processes. Such Items may be composed of other smaller Configuration Items that they depend on and may also be used as dependencies for the construction of greater Items. In other words, some may be composed of pieces and/or act as pieces for others. Tracking of such dependencies is critical for most IT organizations and, as a result, some of the Configuration Items may be tracked in dedicated domain based systems and others may be tracked in formal Configuration Management Databases (CMDBs).
2056.name: Configuration Item Taxonomy

20560.description: The National Mushroom List (Index of Korean Mushroom) is a list of national and scientific names based on the [Korean Mushroom List (2013)] and the [National List of Species (2015]], and reflects the latest scientific names by referring to the MycoBank Database and Index Fungorum. The newly changed genus name is given a name in consideration of morphological characteristics and original meaning to support the use of unified mushroom names

20561.description: The Korea Plant Names Index Committee is a list prepared by organizing plant names based on recent taxonomic research for standardization of plant names, and jointly reviewed and deliberated by the National Arboretum and the Korean Classification Society. The list supports systematic national plant resource management and the use of unified plant names, and is provided through a system that is updated in real time.
20561.name: Korea Plant Names Index

20562.description: The Korea Lichen Name Index is a list prepared by organizing the names of lichens based on recent taxonomic research to standardize the names of lichens in Korea, and jointly reviewed and deliberated by the National Arboretum and the Korean Classification Association. The list supports systematic management of national lichen resources and is available for download on the Internet through real-time updates
20562.name: Korea Lichen Name Index

20564.description:
The Dictionary of Gugak is a knowledge base in the fields of traditional Korean music, 歌, and dance.

It provides an accurate and concrete understanding of Korean traditional music and traditional dance, and provides five senses of the reality and beauty of Korean traditional music and traditional dance through various media. To this end, we intend to expand the convenience of foreigners and information-vulnerable groups so that more people can use the Korean traditional music dictionary by making the terms and description of the Korean traditional music dictionary reflect academic research results, mobilizing the optimal media (writing, sound source, board, video, etc.).
20564.name: Gugak Dictionary

20565.description: The Korean traditional music industry classification system is a classification used in the National Gugak Center's statistical survey of the Korean classical music industry (2019~). It was first included as a 2019 Korean classical music industry statistical survey [Appendix 1] and contains opinions on the classification as an appendix every year. It provides a comparison table with the Korean Standard Industrial Classification Table and aims to enter the national statistics of the 'Korean classical music industry statistical survey'.
20565.name: Korean traditional music industry classification system

20566.description: The list of marine and marine life resources subject to export approval is a list of marine and marine life resources designated by the Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries to restrict export to species of high economic, ecological, and academic value. In order to export, an application for approval, including the purpose and management plan, must be submitted and approved by the Minister of Oceans and Fisheries. The list is selected through expert evaluation and a review by the Committee on the Selection of Marine and Marine Life Resources subject to approval.
20566.name: List of marine and marine life resources subject to approval for export abroad

20567.description: The National Assembly Records Classification Standard Table is prepared and operated by the head of the National Assembly Library based on the work process, and includes unit business names, explanations, documentation, and retention periods. The standard table is managed by the National Assembly Records Management System, and new or changed contents are posted on the National Assembly website by the end of March every year and notified to the relevant departments.
20567.name: National Assembly Records Classification Standard Table

20568.description:
Detailed classification table by function of military supplies is one of the classifications of military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Munitions Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Munitions Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Munitions Management Act, and corresponds to the detailed classification table for each function in [Asterisk 3] of Article 10 (classification by function) of the Munitions Management Order.


National Legal Information Center - Article 10 of the Military Supplies Management Order (Ministry of National Defense Order No. 2942) (20241029)

1. Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Control Act

[Enforcement July 2, 2019] [Presidential Decree No. 29950, July 2, 2019, Amendment to other laws]
Article 3 (classification of military supplies, etc.) In order to efficiently manage military supplies, the Minister of National Defense shall classify military supplies by use, function, and nature, or as prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense.


2. Enforcement Rules of the Military Supplies Control Act

[Enforcement on October 25, 2021] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No.1068, October 25, 2021, amendment of other laws]
Article 3 (classification of military supplies) The methods of classifying military supplies prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense pursuant to Article 3 of the Decree are as follows. <Amendment February 12, 2014>
3. Classification by function: Method of classification into firepower, maneuver, telecommunications electronics, special weapons, ships, aviation and general equipment, ammunition, duties, and other general materials
[Professional revision November 6, 2009]


3. Military Supplies Management Order

[Enforcement 2024.7.9.] [Ministry of National Defense Order No. 2942, 2024.7.9. Partial Revision] Chapter 2 Classification of Munitions
Article 5 (Purpose of Classification) Munitions may be classified into the methods of classification under each subparagraph of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Guns Management Act and Articles 8 through 13 of this directive in order to systematically perform the duties of the department in charge, budgeting and settlement of accounts, registration and management of the military information system, investigation and settlement of accounts.
Article 10 (classification by function) Munitions shall be classified into firepower, special weapons, maneuvers, aviation, ships, telecommunications electronics, general equipment, precise measurement, tools, ammunition, duties, and materials by function pursuant to subparagraph 3 of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Gun Goods Management Act. In this case, detailed classification by function shall be in accordance with attached Table 3 (Detailed Classification Table by Gun Goods Function).
20568.name: Detailed classification table by function of military supplies

20569.description:
Munitions inventory is a systematic integration of information on the classification, identification, and management of munitions, and is carried out in accordance with the Defense Acquisition Program Administration Act and related regulations. Its main purpose is to increase the efficiency of munitions management and to maintain a system consistent with international standards.


1. a key element

legal basis
In accordance with Article 27 of the Defense Acquisition Program Administration, the Defense Acquisition Program Administration classifies munitions by product name and inventory number, and manages them as munitions list information.
Relevant laws and regulations require compliance with the International Listing System (NATO).
Listing Process
Item identification: Data generation including item name, inventory number, characteristic information, etc.
Inventory number assignment: National inventory number system based on NATO inventory number (NSN).
Manage and update: Maintain data consistency by modifying, deleting, and adding list information.
international cooperation
The Republic of Korea is a certified sponsor of the NATO Listing System, which utilizes common terms and procedures among NATO member states to carry out the listing.
The Defense Acquisition Program Administration supports international exchange of list information and data integration.
Coverage
It is cataloged for items that are repeatedly procured, stored, and distributed among munitions, and technical materials, drawings, and specifications are used.
It includes various types of munitions such as weapon systems, power support systems, and software.

2. Significance of Listing Military Supplies Listing ensures consistency and efficiency in data management throughout defense businesses, and enables international standardized information exchange. This ensures transparency and speed in the management and procurement of military supplies at home and abroad.
20569.name: Munitions inventory

2057.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of the many different Configuration Management types that are tracked, managed and performed as part of the Configuration Management discipline and its related set of processes. These areas of Configuration Management concern themselves with their corresponding Configuration Types and, also, their correlating Configuration Item Types. While the Foundation acknowledges that each category has a different level of importance to different enterprises, the taxonomy serves to highlight just how many different areas of Configuration Management exist and that must be dealt with by many enterprises. Examples of how some of these types of Configuration Management categories fit into an enterprise can be seen in the IT Deployment Framework, which calls out the different, Deployment related Configuration Management Types.
2057.name: Configuration Management Taxonomy

20570.description:
The Detailed classification table by type of military supplies is one of the classifications of military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Munitions Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Munitions Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Munitions Management Act.


1. Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Control Act

[Enforcement July 2, 2019] [Presidential Decree No. 29950, July 2, 2019, Amendment to other laws]
Article 3 (classification of military supplies, etc.) In order to efficiently manage military supplies, the Minister of National Defense shall classify military supplies by use, function, and nature, or as prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense.


2. Enforcement Rules of the Military Supplies Control Act

[Enforcement on October 25, 2021] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No.1068, October 25, 2021, amendment of other laws]
Article 3 (classification of military supplies) The methods of classifying military supplies prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense pursuant to Article 3 of the Decree are as follows. <Amendment February 12, 2014>
2. Classification by Type: Methods of classification by general type, such as food, cladding, and weaponry


3. Military Supplies Management Order

[Enforcement 2024.7.9.] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No. 2942, 2024.7.9. Partially amended]
Chapter 2 Classification of Military Supplies
Article 5 (Purpose of Classification) Munitions may be classified into the methods of classification under each subparagraph of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Guns Management Act and Articles 8 through 13 of this directive in order to systematically perform the duties of the department in charge, budgeting and settlement of accounts, registration and management of the military information system, investigation and settlement of accounts.
Article 9 (classification by type) Munitions shall be classified into 1 type (food), 2 types (general goods), 3 types (milk), 4 types (construction materials), 5 types (bulk goods), 6 types (welfare store sales), 7 types (equipment), 8 types (mandatory equipment/materials), 9 types (repair attachment/tools), 10 types (other goods) for each item with similar purpose, nature, and distribution method. In this case, detailed classification by type shall be in accordance with attached Table 2 (detailed classification table by type of county products).
20570.name: Detailed classification table by type of military supplies

20571.description: The Classification of Military Supplies is a method of classifying military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Military Supplies Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Military Supplies Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Management Act.
20571.name: Classification of military supplies

20572.description: Climate Change Words Explanation is a booklet that selects and solves related words related to key terms that are frequently used from the public's perspective among terms on the causes and effects of climate change. There is a booklet and a wiki version, and the original PDF can be downloaded by the "download" button, and the "shortcut" button connects to the climate change science terminology explanation wiki. The explanation wiki for climate change science terminology is a wiki of the booklet.
20572.name: Climate Change Words Explanation

20573.description:
The North-South Forest Comparison Glossary is a comparison of inter-Korean forest terms published in 2021 by the National Institute of Forest Science. For the smooth forest cooperation project between the two Koreas, the terms used in the overall forest fields such as planting and afforestation, forest pests, and all directions were investigated for two years, and published after expert advice. In the future, follow-up work will be conducted through advice from forest experts and Korean language experts (pre-editing experts).


*an investigated and organized dictionary

The investigation and arrangement were conducted based on the forest terminology dictionary published by the South and the North.

The South Korean terminology was based on the preliminary ⌋ of ⌈ forest forestry terms, and was organized by reflecting the ⌋ of ⌈ forest administration purification terms additionally announced by the Korea Forest Service.
The North Korean terminology was used as basic data by investigating the North Korean terminology corresponding to the ⌈ Forest ⌋ Terminology Dictionary ⌋ published by North Korea in 2020 and the inspection of experts by field.
20573.name: North-South Forest Comparison Glossary

20574.description:
The Classification System of Science and Technology for Food, Agriculture, and Forestry was created to efficiently manage information, manpower, and R&D projects related to agriculture, food, science and technology. It is linked to the National Science and Technology Table Classification System.


1. History

Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Notification No. 2014-126: Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Science and Technology Classification System
Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Notification No. 2019-84: Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Science and Technology Classification System
20574.name: Classification System of Science and Technology for Food, Agriculture, and Forestry

20575.description: The Agricultural Data Classification System was developed for the systematic management of relics owned by the National Agricultural Museum and data in the domestic agricultural field. This classification system can be found on page 65 of the 2023 National Agricultural Museum's annual report.
20575.name: Agricultural data classification system

20576.description: The Standards for Classification of Places of Business for Air Pollutant-Emitting Facilities classifies workplaces from 1 to 5 types according to the amount of pollutants generated from air pollutant discharge facilities.
20576.name: Standards for Classification of Places of Business for Air Pollutant-Emitting Facilities

20577.description: The categories of urban agriculture is a type of urban agriculture prescribed in Article 8 (1) of the Act on the Promotion and Support of Urban Agriculture, and when the State and local governments foster and support urban agriculture, they establish and implement policies to suit the characteristics of each type of urban agriculture under paragraph (1). Detailed classification by type is prescribed in Article 2 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Promotion and Support of Urban Agriculture.
20577.name: Categories of Urban Agriculture

20578.description:
The Classification System of Diagnostics and Treatment of Animals is a standardized classification system for animal care, such as animal disease names and treatment items, announced by the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs for the systematic development of animal care. In the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs' Notice No. 2024-30, "Recommended Standards for Animal Care," the recommended standard medical procedures for animal hospital frequent treatment items (20 types) are set as an asterisk, and detailed medical guidelines according to the standard medical procedures are prepared by the head of the veterinary clinic and provided to the veterinarian by posting them on the website of the veterinarian association.

The standard medical manual can be checked only by signing up as a member of the Korean Veterinary Medical Association, and membership can be registered after checking only those with veterinarian license numbers.
20578.name: Classification System of Diagnosis and Treatment of Animals

20579.description:
The Display HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is the first of four guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service and was produced in accordance with the implementation of HS 2022. HS standard analysis guidelines for secondary batteries, semiconductors, and automobiles are provided, including this guideline in the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal.


Display, the first impression of electronic products, has endless growth potential as a key item that leads Korea's exports along with semiconductors such as 83% of global market share of OLED. Accordingly, the Korea Customs Service made various efforts to establish international standards for item classification for related goods, and as a result, international standards commonly used by all countries were newly established (No. 8524) from '22.1.1, further enhancing the convenience and predictability of item classification.


<Volume 1> Display HS Standard Analysis Guidelines

It contains HSK information on a total of 285 related items, including the newly changed Display Module (No. 8524) in 22 years and equipment and raw and subsidiary materials used to manufacture them. Item classification is essential information for customs clearance, trade transactions, and statistics for various policy-making, and anyone can easily and quickly check the item number by using this guide if they have the existing HSK and product information.
20579.name: Display HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines

2058.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Data Entities that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.
2058.name: Data Entity Taxonomy

20580.description: Classification of Weapons Systems classifies weapons for combat power in battlefields, such as guided weapons, aircraft, and ships, and integrated elements such as equipment, parts, facilities, and software necessary to operate them
20580.name: Classification of Weapons Systems

20581.description: The Munhanuri card Affiliate store classification system classifies the merchants who can use the Munhanuri card* into major, middle, sub-class, and business and items. The classification table can be found in the "Businesses and Items Registered as Affiliate" section of the "Manghanuri website">Manghanuri card>Manghanuri card registration guide, and the non-permitted businesses and items of the Munhanuri card can also be found. Meanwhile, since 2019, the company has been posting posts related to the "Manghanuri card merchant classification table and prevention of illegal use" on its website notices, so you can check the previous classification information.
20581.name: Munhwanuri card Affiliate store classification system

20582.description: Goods classification guidelines are guidelines for classifying goods of central administrative agencies established under the Constitution or the Government Organization Act or other laws, and are guidelines prescribed by the Article 5 of the Commodity Management Act
20582.name: Goods classification guidelines

20583.description:
Semiconductor HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines are one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service and are provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal. The HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal provides guidelines for HS standard analysis for displays, secondary batteries, and automobiles, including this guideline.


Consisting of two sectors, the first half (standard interpretation guidelines) included item numbers for 258 types of raw materials, parts, and equipment for each semiconductor production process, and photos and detailed explanations for each product, and the second half (technical data collection) explained the latest semiconductor information and trends, semiconductor power generation process, semiconductor production process, and technical terms along with diagrams to help basic understanding of semiconductors, making them widely available not only to industry officials but also to related policy authorities.
20583.name: Semiconductor HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines

20584.description: The Standards for classification of cost components of cost components of defense cost are classified into material costs, labor costs, expenses, general management costs, and profits.
20584.name: Standards for classification of cost components of defense cost-eligible materials

20585.description: Insecticide and Pest Information: Insect is a list of 'insect' information provided by the National Agricultural and Plant Disease Control System. In this list, basic information about insects (Korean species, species name, full name/cultivation name, tree/cultivation name, genus name, English name, quarantine information), target natural insect information, crop damage information, and insect photo information are provided. Information provided for each insect may be different.
20585.name: Disease and Pest Information(by Disease and Pest):Insect

20586.description: The Classification of Health and Medical Service Technology is a classification system for efficiently managing information, manpower, research, and development projects related to health and medical technology and is stipulated in Article 7-2 of the Health and Medical Technology Promotion Act (Preparation of the Health and Medical Technology Classification System). When creating a health and medical technology classification system, it must be prepared in connection with the national science and technology standard classification table, and measures such as improvement shall be taken by reviewing the feasibility every three years.
20586.name: Classification of Health and Medical Service Technology

20587.description: Industrial Accident Insurance Premium Rates by Business Type and Examinations of Business Types is a classification of industrial accident insurance rates paid by employers for compensation for workers' occupational accidents by industry, and the Minister of Employment and Labor announces the premium rates for 28 business types by December every year. The business type example table stipulates tax items and content examples to apply the premium rates for each industry.
20587.name: Industrial Accident Insurance Premium Rates by Business Type and Examples of Business Types

20588.description: The Classification of Fields of Service for Social Service Personnel is a classification of areas in which social service personnel should serve as stipulated in Article 47-3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Military Service Act pursuant to Article 26 (3) of the Military Service Act.
20588.name: Classification of Fields of Service for Social Service Personnel

20589.description: 산업기술분류표(Industrial Technology Classification Table)은 산업기술혁신사업의 기획ㆍ평가ㆍ관리에 관한 업무를 효율적으로 추진하기 위해 수립한 분류체계의 분류표이다. 이 분류표는 '산업기술혁신사업 공통 운영요령 제16조'에 의하여 '동 행정규칙 별도표1 산업기술분류표' 에서 정하고 있다.
20589.name: Industrial Technology Classification Table

2059.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different enterprise Discipline related Document types or classifications. Such types are used by IT Professionals and the enterprises they provide services to as a means of identifying, defining, classifying, organizing, storing, and publishing different enterprise documents.
