This taxonomy is critical to multiple enterprise Disciplines such as Document Management, Artifact Management, and Records Management. Such taxonomies are commonly used in Document Management Systems as a means of tagging Documents as a means of assisting in organization and search.
2059.name: Document Taxonomy

20590.description:
The Industry Association Table Sector Classification is a classification system used to prepare the Bank of Korea's Input-Output Table (statistics table), which includes product classification and industry classification. The classification can be confirmed as follows. 'Bank of Korea Economic Statistics System > Statistical Search > Statistics Table > 2.2 Input-Output Table > 2.2.n. yyyyy Year Actual Table > 2.2.n.1 File Download' 

Example) 2020 Input-Output Table Division Classification: Bank of Korea Economic Statistics System>Statistics Search>Statistics Table>2.2 Input-Output Table>2.1. 2020 Measurement Table>2.1.1 File Downloads> 2020 Segment Classification Table
20590.name: Industry Association Table Sector Classification

20591.description: Commercial information system industry classification is a commercial analysis data provided by the commercial information system of the Ministry of SMEs and Startups, which is divided into major, middle, and sub-classification, and is searched in sub-classification units. The classification information can be checked as an Excel file in the notification information in the system, and it provides free information necessary for start-ups and management by analyzing commercial districts, competitions, locations, and profits.
20591.name: Commercial information system industry classification

20592.description:
Service Industry Classification is a classification of industries related to the service industry based on a major classification in the Korean Standard Industrial Classification.

The Korean Standard Industrial Classification (KSIC) consists of the following 16 major categories (E, G, U) based on the major categories

Code : Classification Name 
E: Water, sewage and waste disposal, and raw material regeneration business	
G: Wholesale and retail business	
H: Transportation and warehouse business
I: Accommodation and restaurant business	
J: Information and communication business	
K : Financial and insurance businesses	
L: Real estate business	
Man: Professional, scientific and technical service industries
N: Business facility management, business support, and rental service business
O: Public administration, defense and social security administration
P: Education service industry
Q: Health and social welfare services
R: Arts, sports and leisure services
S: Associations and organizations, repair and other personal services businesses
T : Employment activities in households and self-consumption production activities
U: International and foreign institutions
20592.name: Service Industry Classification

20593.description: The Election Commission Records Classification Standard Table is prepared and operated in accordance with the records management rules of the permanent records management agency, and includes management items such as job description, retention period, storage place, and disclosure status. Records are created and managed by the records management system, and new records and changes are notified to the information and communication network every year. In the case of administrative information data sets, a separate management standard is prepared and operated.
20593.name: Election Commission Records Classification Standard Table

20594.description: The Classification of Juvenile Training Centers is the classification of juvenile detention centers pursuant to Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Act on the Treatment of Protected Juvenile, etc. by classifying them into elementary and secondary education, vocational competency development training, medical rehabilitation, etc. by function, and multiple names may be used. Multiple names of juvenile centers shall be in accordance with the guidelines on the functions and multiple use of names of juvenile centers, etc
20594.name: Classification of Juvenile Training Centers

20595.description: The Classification of Fire Equipment is classified according to its purpose and function, and is stipulated in Articles 6 and [Attachment 1] of the Enforcement Decree of the same Act under Articles 2 (1) and 8 of the Fire Equipment Management Act. Matters concerning the classification criteria, procedures, detailed items, etc. of fire fighting equipment classified in the Enforcement Decree [Attachment 1] shall be prescribed in Articles 3 and 4 of the Regulations on the Classification of Fire Equipment, etc. and [Attachment 1].
20595.name: Classification of Fire Equipment

20596.description: Veterinary medical terminology (English-Korean, Korean-English) is the first veterinary terminology published in 2006 jointly by the Korean Veterinary Society and the Korean Veterinary Society. It contributed greatly to education and research in the field of veterinary and livestock by unifying difficult Chinese character expressions and inaccurate foreign language notation of veterinary terms used at the time.
20596.name: Veterinary medical terminology:English-Korean·Korean-English

20597.description:
The list of infectious disease pathogens subject to import permission is a list of pathogens for infectious diseases of animals provided by the Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Administration. It also provides a list of exemptions for import permission.


Article 32 (3) of the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act and [Regulations on the Management of Veterinary Life Resources for Livestock Infectious Diseases Pathogens, etc.] *Release the list to the website of the Korea Veterinary Life Resources Bank (http://kahis.go.kr:9000/kvcc) at the bottom of Appendix 1 and **Attachment 2 from time to time.

*[Attached Table 1] Special management pathogens: Type 1 livestock infectious disease pathogens specified in the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act (hereinafter referred to as the "Home Appliance Act") and pathogens designated by the head of the Agriculture, Forestry and Livestock Quarantine Headquarters (hereinafter referred to as the "head of the quarantine headquarters")

**[Attached Table 2] General management pathogens: Pathogens other than special management pathogens among Class 2 and 3 livestock infectious diseases specified in the Home Appliance Act, pathogens designated by the head of the quarantine headquarters (Attached Table 2), and other pathogens of infectious diseases of animals
20597.name: List of infectious livestock pathogens subject to import permission

20598.description:
The treatment level of Sentenced Inmates is the treatment level of prisoners prescribed in Articles 72, 73, 74, and 76 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Penal Execution Act. The treatment level is divided into basic accommodation level, security treatment level, and individual treatment level.

Inmate: The term "inmate" means a person who has been sentenced to imprisonment, imprisonment, or detention and has been imprisoned in a correctional facility and has been imprisoned in a correctional facility with an order to attract a labor center for failing to pay fines or fines in full.
Treatment grade: The term "treatment grade" means a standard for distinguishing facilities to accommodate inmates, the degree of accounting for inmates, the level of treatment and the contents of treatment in relation to the treatment and management of inmates.
20598.name: Treatment Level of Sentenced Inmates

20599.description: The Korea New and Renewable Energy Center Terms is a dictionary related to new and renewable energy that allows you to check terms and explanatory information. It is provided on the website of the Korea Energy Agency's New and Renewable Energy Center. You can check terms in alphabetical order.
20599.name: Korea New and Renewable Energy Center Terms

206.description: The conceptual list was prepared by deaf and hearing students of the Department of Psychology at the University of Hamburg, taking into account suggestions from deaf pedagogy as well as psychological and psychotherapeutic work with deaf people, including the introductory literature of the seven subject areas of general psychology, biopsychology, differential psychology , Developmental and pedagogic psychology, clinical psychology, cognitive psychology and social psychology, and was compared with already existing psychological specialties, with the aim of selecting a basic vocabulary for a psychological study at a predefined upper limit of about 1000 terms Of the employees from their studies were included in the selection.Systematic aspects could only be considered to a very limited extent Nter are references to the existing sign language variants for this entry. If you click on one of the reference pictures, the display will jump to the part of the lexicon entry belonging to this variant below. These include supplementary information on the lemma: common abbreviations (ABK), synonyms (AUCH), or, in the case of conceptual pairs, the connotation (eg 'Efference': 'AUCH: Gegenbegriff: Afferenz'). Below the definition text are listed the top terms to which the respective term can be assigned. The subject areas, with the exception of the applied psychology, are divided into a total of 37 terms. An upper term was recorded if at least 4 items could be assigned to it. The upper concepts were not further hierarchized among themselves, since this would have been possible only in very few cases. They also do not always agree with the terms of the technical terms, e.g. (Learning, observation, learning, distributed, etc.) are to be found under the heading 'learning and learning theories'. The lemmas, which could not be assigned to a specific concept within a discipline, are to be found under an umbrella term which is nominally identical to the subject area. The lexicon is primarily intended for deaf students and interpreters. However, it also offers valuable information and suggestions for all persons who use sign language in psychological contexts (psychologists, medical practitioners, educators, social workers / social workers and others).
206.name: Professional sign language dictionary Psychology Alphabetical index

2060.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different File Plan Types or Categories that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations, professionals and their business clients, such as Records Management Organizations, to help identify, define, manage, and support the many different File Plan Types that are used to facilitate, both, File Plan Management and Records Management solutions.
2060.name: File Plan Taxonomy

20600.description:
The ARKO Arts Archive collections Description is a material that introduces the archives of the ARKO Arts Archive*. It provides a detailed list and overview of the archives currently planned and produced or collected by the ARKO Arts Archives.


*The Arko Art Archives collects, preserves, and serves important records that examine the flow of modern and contemporary Korean art history, and also promotes records production projects such as oral records and performance visualization projects. Additionally, various programs such as exhibitions, education, and research based on collection records are carried out while books, records, and videos that are highly related to the history of modern and contemporary Korean art are purchased and serviced.
20600.name: ARKO Arts Archive collections Description

20601.description: Malodor-Emitting Facilities Classification is a facility designated by the Minister of Environment in consultation with the heads of relevant central administrative agencies pursuant to subparagraph 3 of Article 2 of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor and Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act, and includes facilities, machinery, equipment, etc. that cause odors. The specific classification of the relevant facilities is specified in attached Table 2 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor, and shall be managed by reflecting the amendments every year. The facilities for discharging odors under subparagraph 3 of Article 2 of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor shall be prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor, and facilities for discharging odors shall be as shown in attached Table 2.
20601.name: Malodor-Emitting Facilities Classification

20602.description:
The Children's Book Association Subject Heading Theseaurus is a tool that supports the search of children's and adolescents' book recommendation lists as subject words and related words together to support effective search.

*The Children's Book Research Association selects good children's books every year and recommends them to <<Children's and Youth Books>>. Since 1995, recommended lists have been published every year and distributed free of charge to public and private libraries, community children's centers, and local bookstores, which can also be searched on the website of the Children's Book Research Association. The recommended list can also be searched as a subject word, and the subject word dictionary is a dictionary that can be used to search for the subject word, and words related to the subject word can also be viewed.
20602.name: Children's Book Research Society Keyword Dictionary

20603.description:
The Trade Secret Classification Guide is a guide for calculating and classifying secret grades of information and data held by companies.

Technology information such as R&D and production and management information such as personnel, general affairs, accounting, purchase and sales are representative of the information held by companies. Such information can be protected as trade secrets only when it meets economic usefulness, non-publicity, and confidentiality. In particular, the court makes it a major criterion for reviewing whether general information and trade secrets are separately managed when determining whether confidential management is satisfied in the event of a trade secret leakage accident.

However, companies have complained of difficulties in classifying and rating their information because there has been no adequate standard for systematic secret grade classification so far.

Accordingly, it is intended to support companies to efficiently establish trade secret management strategies by presenting the criteria for selecting appropriate protection measures (patents, trade secrets, etc.) for information held by companies, and by presenting a method of calculating the grade of information managed as trade secrets and an appropriate level of management for each grade.

This guide was derived through the research ⌋ (Korea Intellectual Property Office, 2016) to establish a classification system for ⌈ trade secret data, and can be modified and utilized to suit the reality of each company.
20603.name: Trade Secret Classification Guide

20604.description:
Classification of Outdoor Advertisements is a classification of outdoor advertisements under Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Outdoor Advertisement Act, and is a display method for five types of advertisements, such as advertisements that require consultation between central administrative agencies, rooftop signboards corresponding to advertisements of wide area characteristics, landowners' signs, and advertisements using transportation facilities. The method of displaying remaining advertisements not prescribed by this Act shall be determined by city/provincial ordinances.

Outdoor advertisements: The term "outdoor advertisements" means signs and digital advertisements (including those displayed on transportation facilities or means of transportation prescribed by Presidential Decree) that are always exposed to the public or continuously for a certain period of time and can be seen in places where the public freely passes (including those displayed on transportation facilities or means of transportation prescribed by Presidential Decree), signboards, banners, wallpapers, and leaflets (傳單) and other similar ones.
20604.name: Classification of Outdoor Advertisements

20605.description:
Online dictionary of environmental terms: 50 key terms

A dictionary of environmental terminology published in 2018 by the Ministry of Environment's policy promotion team. Fifty major terms were selected from the online environmental terminology dictionary and explained in an easy-to-understand manner the policy systems and related concepts related to recent environmental issues. The contents are largely divided into 1. environmental conservation, 2. air transportation, 3. climate future, 4. water environment, 5. natural conservation 6. resource circulation, and 7. environmental general. You can read the original text at the Environmental Digital Library.
20605.name: Online dictionary of environmental terms: 50 key terms

20606.description:
Korean Thesaurus: The relationship between the description of terms and terms (Choi's Thesaurus) is a control vocabulary for Korean words that structures the relationship between the semantic information of terms and related terms.

Most algorithms for processing unstructured data have already been developed and known, but structured data are required to process them more precisely. To this end, terms have been collected since 1993 under the goal of constructing metadata for Korean terms that have a relationship between semantic information and terms, and they have been described as standard thesaurus structure. Thesaurus is widely known as a form of structuring terms and concisely abstracts complex relationships between terms. In this dictionary, the standard thesaurus structure is basically adopted and additionally expanded.

The subject of the registered terms includes nouns such as subject name, life, institution/organization name, place name, animal name, plant name, legal name, literature name, monument name, product name, meeting/assembly name, event name, etc., and verbs and adjectives. As of August 2013, 1.3 million terms (800,000 terms in Korean, 510,000 terms in foreign language. See statistical functions for more information) were registered and terminology relationships were defined. Although it is not yet sufficient, it is thought that we have constructed a sufficient amount of data to process unstructured data in the field to some extent, so we will disclose the results so far. More than 10,000 terms of new terms are added every month, and this work will continue along with the revision work.
20606.name: Choi's Thesaurus

20607.description:
Urimalsaem is a user-participating dictionary that collects and creates words used in real life, newly emerged words, and words used in the region with the people.


Introduce the Korean language fountain

1. What's a Korean word fountain?

When I'm curious about the use of Korean, I look for a Korean dictionary. However, there are times when I feel disappointed because there is no information or it is difficult to explain even when I look for a dictionary. This is because there are various restrictions on the dictionaries published so far, so the information has been compressed and included in a limited way.

The Korean Language Sam, in which the user participates, was designed to overcome this problem. All of us who speak Korean want to be the main subjects and include vocabulary that was used before or is currently used in a more diverse and easy-to-understand manner. In addition to traditional dictionary information, it also aims to provide various language knowledge to answer many questions about the Korean language.

'Korean Horse Spring' encompasses various fields such as new words, dialects, and technical terms.
In addition to the words in the "Standard Korean Dictionary" published by the National Institute of the Korean Language, there have been many words that have not been published in the Korean dictionary but are actually used. It started with a million words, but the number will continue to increase.

In "Korean Sam," anyone interested in Korean can participate in editing.
Until now, editing of dictionaries has been exclusive to dictionary experts. "Korean Language Sam" opens up editing so that anyone interested in Korean can share their Korean knowledge.

"Korean Horse Sam" aims to increase the reliability of the information contained through expert supervision.
In "Korean Horse Sam," experts from each field participate to check the newly edited content and refine the expression.


2. Characteristics of the Korean horse's gland

Openness
-  It contains Korean materials in various fields such as new words, dialects, and technical terms
-  End User Joins Edit
-  Free use of information with knowledge donations based on free copyright policies

Connectivity
- Application of international standards to enable information exchange and connection with domestic and foreign institutions
- Enhanced secondary utilization of information on portable devices, Internet sites, etc

Practicality
- Provide a variety of language information needed by the general public
- Apply user-friendly, web-based environments
20607.name: Urimalsaem

20608.description:
The Assignment Devices or Amnesty Rides Classification is the classification of organic facilities or organic equipment* for safety inspection. In the Enforcement Regulations of the Tourism Promotion Act, it is divided into organic facilities or organic equipment subject to safety inspection and organic facilities or organic equipment not subject to safety inspection.


*GAME MACHINE OR GAME MACHINE

It means facilities, equipment, etc. installed to be used in a standardized manner within a certain space by utilizing machinery, electricity, electronic devices, etc. for the purpose of providing fun, enjoyment, and thrill to users. ( Provided, That this shall not apply to buildings that have obtained permission, authorization, etc. pursuant to other Acts and subordinate statutes, such as the Building Act, and to organic facilities or auxiliary facilities of organic equipment.)
20608.name: Amusement Devices or Amusement Rides Classification

20609.description:
Classification and List of Noxious Liquid Substances is a classification and list of hazardous liquid substances under Article 2, Item 7 of the Marine Environment Management Act, and is stipulated in Article 3 and [Asterisk 1] of the Rules on Prevention of Pollution in Ships.

[Asterisk 1] Detailed criteria and substance list for classification of hazardous liquid substances

1. Detailed criteria for classification of hazardous liquid substances
2. List of hazardous liquid substances
20609.name: Classification and List of Noxious Liquid Substances

2061.description: The following represents a hierarchical taxonomy of key Enterprise and Information Technology (IT) Glossary Types or Categorizations, along with dynamic HTML links to their semantically grouped Term/Definition pairs. These Glossaries are used by IT organizations, IT professionals and the various enterprises they support to help standardize language, semantics, understanding and communications between individuals and systems and represent the very foundation for Enterprise Knowledge Management.
2061.name: Glossary Taxonomy

20610.description: The Secondary Battery HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service, which is the second guideline after the display. It is provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal. The HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal provides guidelines for HS standard analysis for displays, semiconductors, and automobiles, including this guideline.
20610.name: Secondary Battery HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines

20611.description:
The Automobile Parts HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service, and is the fourth HS standard analysis guideline after displays, secondary batteries, and semiconductors. It is provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal.

This guideline contains the item number (HS 10 units) of 242 major car parts, photographs and detailed descriptions of the corresponding items.

This guideline consists of three parts and includes general parts, eco-friendly car parts, and the latest automotive industry trends.
20611.name: Automobile Parts HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines

20612.description: The Classification of Disaster Management Commodities is one of the classifications of disaster management resources specified in the 'Notification on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.'
20612.name: Classification of Disaster Management Commodities

20613.description: The Classification of Disaster Management Human Resources Organizations is one of the classifications of disaster management resources stipulated in the 'Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources', and human resources institutions are classified into management institutions and institutions, organizations, and corporations by function.
20613.name: Classification of Disaster Management Human Resources Organizations

20614.description: The Disaster Management Resources Catalog Number System and Assignment Method establishes the criteria for creating a list of disaster management goods and the method of granting a list number as stipulated in the "Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.
20614.name: Disaster Management Resources Catalog Number System and Assignment Method

20615.description: The purpose of the Classification of Disaster Management Resources is to prescribe the criteria for classification of disaster management goods and the criteria for the list of goods, the criteria for property list, the criteria for the list of human resources, the criteria for the list of human resources, and the method for granting the list number under Article 25 (1) of the Act on the Management of Disaster Management Resources, etc. and Article 19 (1) 2 of the Enforcement Decree of the same Act.
20615.name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources

20616.description: The Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Type of Disaster and Accidents is one of the classifications of disaster management resources specified in the 'Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.' and is a classification of disaster and accident types for efficient use and linkage of disaster management resources.
20616.name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Type of Disaster and Accident

20617.description: The Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Collaboration Functions is one of the classifications of disaster management resources stipulated in the 'Notice on Classification Standards of Disaster Management Resources, etc.' and classifies physical and human resources into groups or teams in consideration of collaboration functions for efficient use and linkage of disaster management resources.
20617.name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Collaboration Functions

20618.description: The Classification of Disaster Management Property is one of the classifications of disaster management resources prescribed in the 'Notice on Classification Standards, etc. of Disaster Management Resources', and is a classification of assets by type. This facilitates the classification and identification of disaster management resources, and disaster management property is classified according to the criteria specified in attached Table 3. This notification stipulates that the feasibility is reviewed every three years so that improvement can be made.
20618.name: Classification of] Disaster Management Property

20619.description: Types of Force Support Systems is a classification of all elements such as equipment, parts, facilities, software, and other goods other than weapons systems, and is classified in Article 2-2 of the Enforcement Decree of the Defense Acquisition Programming Act, and detailed classification is determined in Article 7 of the Defense Electric Power Generation Ordinance and [Attachment 5].
20619.name: Types of Force Support Systems

2062.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of key forms of Governance that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help manage themselves and to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge within their enterprises. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.
2062.name: Governance Taxonomy

20620.description: According to Article 22 (Standard Classification) of the Statistics Act, the Exhibition Industry Classification is a special classification of the exhibition industry by subdividing the exhibition-related industrial activities among the Korean Standard Industrial Classification for administrative purposes such as statistics and policy execution.
20620.name: Exhibition Industry Classification

20621.description: The Encyclopedia of Library and Information Science is a classification theory that explains the theoretical basis required for structuring knowledge, including understanding, explanation, and practical level of a specific classification system. In addition, it sought a classification system that could accommodate various past knowledge structures. As an appendix, the restaurant script is included.
20621.name: Encyclopedia of Library and Information Science

20622.description:
The Business Reference Model (BRM) classifies administrative agency tasks based on unique functions and defines classified tasks and related information. The classification system by function systematizes them into policy fields, policy areas, large functions, medium functions, small functions, and unit tasks. This system is designed to clearly define and efficiently manage the tasks performed by the government, and related data can be found in the Ministry of Public Administration and Security and the Government Organization Management Information System.

The term "functional classification of administrative affairs" (hereinafter referred to as "functional classification") means classifying the affairs of an administrative agency based on its own functions and defining information related to the classified affairs. The "classification system for each function" classifies the duties regularly performed by the government into policy fields, policy areas, major functions, medium functions, small functions, and unit tasks according to the level of function.
20622.name: Business Reference Model

20623.description: The Grading of Major Communications Facilities (Grading of Major Communications Facilities) is based on the criteria by which major telecommunication business operators classify facilities that need protection in consideration of the matters referred to in Article 23-3 (1) of the Enforcement Decree of the Framework Act on Broadcasting and Communication Development.
20623.name: Grading of Major Communications Facilities

20624.description: The Ironmaking Technology in the Jungwon Region: A List of Ironmaking Sites shows that the Jungwon region is optimized for iron production thanks to the Namhan River water system and its abundant resources such as iron ore, charcoal, and clay. About 20 ironmaking sites have been excavated from the Three Kingdoms period to the Joseon Dynasty in Chungcheongbuk-do, and in particular, in Chungju, 96 ironmaking sites and 456 coal tanks were identified at 45 sites, proving that iron production was actively carried out. Representative relics include Jincheon Seokjang-ri, Gusan-ri, Chungju Chilgeum-dong, Daehwa-ri, and Cheongwon Yeonje-ri.
20624.name: Ironmaking Technology in the Jungwon Region: A List of Ironmaking Sites

20625.description: The Severity Classification Table is a method of classifying casualties occurring at a disaster site. The rules on emergency rescue response activities and on-site command are in accordance with the severity classification table in Appendix 7, and are classified into four stages: death, emergency, emergency, and non-emergency.
20625.name: Severity Classification Table

20626.description: Earthquake Terminology is a terminology description of earthquakes among earthquake information (common sense related to earthquakes) provided by the Jeju Disaster and Safety Countermeasures Headquarters. It provides terminology and brief explanations.
20626.name: Earthquake Terminology

20627.description:
A portrait is a painting of a specific person. In ancient documents, the names Jin 眞, Yeong 影, Jinyoung 眞影, Yeongjeong 影幀, and Burn 畫 were used. During the Joseon Dynasty, as the idea of Sunghyeon, which honors and honors ancestors, became widespread, portraits of kings and royal figures or ordinary nobles were actively produced.

The National Institute of Cultural Heritage's Art and Cultural Heritage Research Center will push for the "Korea Portrait DB Construction Project" to make it easier and more convenient for Koreans to find state-designated portraits scattered across the country in one place. In particular, we would like to contribute to the research and enjoyment of our art heritage by allowing us to look at portraits that were difficult for the general public to access because they were owned by individuals, families, and private institutions in ultra-high-resolution images of more than 100 million pixels.

The number of state-designated portraits to be presented in this project is 83 cases and 131 national treasures, 7 national treasures, 76 treasures, and 106 portraits are as follows.
20627.name: National Portrait List

20628.description:
The Taekwondo Term Dictionary is a complete revision of the Taekwondo Technical Dictionary published by Kukkiwon in 2010.

The 215-page dictionary summarized the terms by dividing the Taekwondo skill system diagram into △ attack techniques (scratching, stabbing, shooting, hitting, kicking, breaking, turning over), △ defense techniques (blocking, subtracting, avoiding) △ assistive techniques (standing, jumping, catching, pushing, preparation posture, special items).

The term dictionary contains not only the terms and meanings of each technology, but also examples in which the terms can be used in various ways and useful information not presented in the meaning solving.

In particular, the institute tried to help readers understand by including photos of members of the Taekwondo Demonstration Team of Kukkiwon, which embodied terms in the dictionary of terms.

In addition, all technologies posted in the term dictionary can be checked by video using QR codes.
20628.name: Taekwondo Term Dictionary

20629.description: The Standard Terminology Dictionary is a service that allows the National Institute of Technology and Standards to build and search 100,000 KS terms (the terms that exist in the KS standard book) in a database (DB) through e-National Standard Certification (www.standards.go.kr ), an integrated government-wide standard and certification search portal. Through the standard term dictionary search, industrial and academic workers can easily find and use technical terms.
20629.name: Standard Terminology Dictionary

2063.description:
The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Inventories that are used and should be maintained by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals. Such Inventories help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge that are important to IT Organizations, IT Professionals, and their Business Stakeholders. Specifically, maintaining current and up to date Inventories is a best practice that ensures better transparency into the enterprise and which leads to good operational metrics for better decision making.

Such a Taxonomy is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. These constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.
2063.name: Inventory Taxonomy

20630.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology contains definitions of terms that are essential for understanding Korean archaeology and summarize the most basic concepts and important relics excavated and investigated in Korea
20630.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology

20631.description:
The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology (2014) is an English version of the dictionary using the Korean archaeological dictionary and specialized dictionary by field to share representative research results of Korean archaeology with foreign academia and enhance foreign researchers' understanding of Korean ancient history.

It includes the definition of terms that are essential for understanding Korean archaeology and summarize the most basic concepts and important relics excavated and investigated in Korea. It also introduced related relics from neighboring countries, such as Japan, China, and Russia, which are directly related to Korean archaeology.
20631.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology(English Edition)

20632.description: The Korean 考 Dictionary of Archaeology: 典 of Ancient 墳遺 專 (Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Burial Goods in the Ancient Korean Graves) contains terminology explanations for more than 600 important artifacts excavated from ancient tombs in Korea, making it easier for the general public to understand difficult archaeological terms.
20632.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Burial Goods in the Ancient Korean Graves

20633.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Ancient 墳篇 典: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Ancient Tombs compiled relics and conceptual terms from the end of the early 考 to Unified Silla, and includes materials related to Korean history located not only on the Korean Peninsula but also abroad such as China and Japan.
20633.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Ancient Tombs

20634.description: The Korean Archaeological Dictionary: The Paleolithic 專 典: The 舊 of 考 Archaeology: The Paleolithic is divided into categories of concepts, relics, achievements, and the status of world-famous Paleolithic ruins in Korea, and consists of more than 500 terminology explanations, drawings, and plates, as well as the distribution of historical headings by region and personality.
20634.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Paleolithic

20635.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: The Paleolithic (English Edition) is an English version of the "Korean Archaeological Dictionary - The Paleolithic," published in Korean by the National Institute of Cultural Heritage in 2013, and contains the research results of the Korean Paleolithic Age, which have been excavated and investigated until recently, including previously included contents. 73 important Paleolithic sites excavated in Korea, such as the title of "Research Status and Tasks of the Paleolithic Age in Korea" and the "Pocheon Neulgeori Ruins," were selected as the title words, and the research results were included along with photos and drawings.
20635.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Paleolithic(English Edition)

20636.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Production Sites is a collection of research results related to production sites such as kilns, ironmaking, and workshops on the Korean Peninsula, and includes 342 conceptual titles and 1,513 historical titles.
20636.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Production Sites

20637.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Catles (Signal Fires) is a dictionary that compiles the results of research on fortresses and beacon in Korean archaeology and prepares an official term unification plan.
20637.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:CatlesㆍSignal Fires

20638.description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Neolithic Age describes the achievements of archaeology in the Korean Neolithic Age by dividing the achievements of archaeology into categories such as relics, relics, and concepts, explaining the terms and organizing the main data. In addition to the Korean Peninsula, research results from regions close to our Neolithic culture, such as China, Japan, and Russia, were included, and drawings and plates were included to help readers understand using this dictionary.
20638.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Neolithic Age

20639.description: It is an augmented edition dictionary composed of domestic (I·II) and foreign (III) by supplementing the latest research results made since the publication of the Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: The Bronze Age in 2004, and contains a total of 2,132 cases, including 221 conceptual headings (130 domestic and 91 overseas) and 1,911 historical headings (1516 domestic and 395 overseas).
20639.name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Bronze Age

2064.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key IT Disciplines that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge associated with the many Discplines performed by IT Organizations and their IT Professionals, both, for themselves and for their business stakeholders. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.
2064.name: IT Discipline Taxonomy

20640.description: The Korean National Encyclopedia of Korean Culture was created as a result of a long-term research project in Korea after 1980 by compiling Korean culture for the first time. It contains the most authoritative knowledge information about Korean culture and was written by professional researchers in each field of Korean studies. It is an encyclopedia that allows you to understand the in-depth of Korean culture, such as "Laughter," "恨," and "ghost." It is a dictionary of encyclopedia that does not stop making revisions in order to be reborn as a dictionary that meets the demands of the times.
20640.name: Encyclopedia of Korea Culture

20641.description: The Korean Classification of Crime for Statistical Purpose (KCCS) is a classification system based on the International Classification of Crime for Statistics (ICCS) adopted by the UN Statistical Commission (UNSC) in March 2015. It is a classification to increase the consistency and comparability of crime statistics, and in the classification, 'crime' is regarded as a violation 'action' that exceeds the limit of human behavior punishable by law. It is important to note when using the classification that the Korean Crime Classification is a classification for the purpose of collecting and using statistics, and crime is systematically categorized (classified) according to the type of behavior, and may differ from the existing criminal justice statistics.
20641.name: Korean Classification of Crime for Statistical purposes

20642.description:
The online List of Plant Diseases in Korea provides plant names, disease names, pathogen names and related documents for all diseases that occur in Korean plants. In addition, we would like to provide pictures of the disease's disease and pictures of pathogen microscopy and culture.

(G)The Plant Pathology Review Committee of the Korean Plant Pathology Association manages information and provides related systems at the National Agricultural Science Institute of the Rural Development Administration.

This online list of Korean botanical names reflects the "Korean Botanical Names List 6.2th Edition (2024)." The 6.2nd edition contains 1,432 taxa hosts and 6,765 disease names that occur there.
20642.name: List of Plant Diseases in Korea

20643.description:
The Korean-Foreign Language Learners' Dictionary is a dictionary that translates the title and meaning of the "Basic Korean Dictionary" into 11 languages and is particularly useful for beginner Korean learners.

Korean Basic Dictionary/Korean-Foreign Language Learning Dictionary
1. Korean - Russian
2. Korean - Mongolian
3. Korean - Vietnamese
4. Korean - Spanish
5. Korean - Arabic
6. Korean - English
7. Korean - Indonesian
8. Korean - Japanese
9. Korean - Chinese
10. Korean - Tires
11. Korean - French
20643.name: Korean-Foreign LanguageLearners' Dictionary

20644.description: The Korean History Thesaurus is designed to classify historical terms into 13 themes and life, place names, signatures, and cultural properties so that users can access them without knowing the exact terms. The terms are arranged in a hierarchical structure and can be used as a search dictionary, and they help you understand the historical context by providing information such as the content, time, and year of the terms. The Chinese character notation uses Unicode to prevent conversion errors and maintains a flexible structure considering the convenience of users' search.
20644.name: Korean History Thesaurus

20645.description:
Polk Religion of Villages in Korea is a survey of village community beliefs that are currently handed down at the National Folk Museum of Korea. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced in local village communities, including large cities, and the form is changing briefly, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it is necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing.

In 2007, the National Folk Museum of Korea published an on-site survey report on Korean village beliefs on a nationwide basis from 2005 to 2006. In addition, from 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea divides the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and conducts a survey of village beliefs by region and records them. Through the record of the survey table on the status of village beliefs included in the survey report, it is possible to find out whether the village beliefs continue and disappear over time.
20645.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea

20646.description:
South Korea's Village Faith: Gwangju Metropolitan City, South Jeolla Province (Polk Religion of Villages in Korea - Wangju Metropolitan City and Jeolanam-do)

Starting in 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea has divided the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and is conducting a survey on village beliefs by region. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced and the form is changed briefly in local village communities, including large cities, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it was necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing.

In 2023, a survey of village beliefs was conducted in the Jeolla and Jeju areas. As a result, a report on village beliefs (total of 3 volumes) in ⌈ Korea was published following the Chungcheong area in 2022. This report is composed of three volumes: Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, Jeollabuk-do, and Jeju Special Self-Governing Province. In Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, a total of 49 regions, including 7 Gwangju Metropolitan City and 42 Jeollanam-do, were included. And in Jeollabuk-do, 35 regions of village beliefs were included. In addition, 40 regions of Jeju Special Self-Governing Province included village beliefs. Meanwhile, each report included a list of whether or not it was transmitted for comparison with the 2007 survey on the current status of village beliefs.
20646.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do

20647.description: Village Beliefs in Korea: Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do (Village Beliefs in Korea: Degu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do) is part of a survey of village beliefs by region conducted by the National Folk Museum of Korea, which is the record of Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do among the Gyeongsang village beliefs surveyed in 2024. The National Folk Museum of Korea is preparing a list of village beliefs transmission status table, or continuous status of village beliefs, while investigating village beliefs, and the survey report includes a list of village beliefs transmission status table in Gyeongsangbuk-do in Daegu Metropolitan City in 2024.
20647.name: Village Beliefs in Korea:Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do

20648.description:
Folk Religion of Villages in Korea (Volume1,2) is a survey of nearly 150 folk scholars nationwide on a national scale and unit of Korean village beliefs at the National Folk Museum of Korea in 2005 and 2006. In 2005, the range of time was limited to the Lunar New Year's Day, and village beliefs that took place nationwide at the same time were investigated. In 2006, literature was investigated based on previously published reports, papers, and other data collections, and the status of village beliefs in Korea was identified through a survey for the deficiencies.

The field survey of the first full moon of January 2005 and the current status of village beliefs in 2006 can encompass both the public and diachronic aspects of the current village community beliefs. The first nationwide village faith survey attempted by the National Folk Museum could be the starting point for another folk field survey. Based on these surveys, you will be able to take a step forward in drawing a folk map.

The survey report on village beliefs in Korea published this time consists of 139 village survey reports based on the temporal range of the 2005 Lunar New Year's Day and the spatial range of the whole country, and a current status table on whether village beliefs continue, focusing on regional literature data published up to 2006. Due to the vastness of the data, the status table was published on CD-ROM, not on the paper.
20648.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Volume1,2

20649.description: Village Beliefs in Korea: Ulsan Metropolitan City, South Gyeongsang Province (Ulsan Metropolitan City & Gyeongsangnam-do) is part of a survey of village beliefs by region conducted by the National Folk Museum of Korea and is a record of Ulsan Metropolitan City and South Gyeongsang Province among the Gyeongsang village beliefs surveyed in 2024. The National Folk Museum of Korea is preparing a list of village beliefs transmission status table, or continuous status of village beliefs, while investigating village beliefs, and the survey report includes a list of village beliefs transmission status table in Ulsan Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangnam-do City in 2024 (= list of continuous status of village beliefs in Gyeongsangnam-do, Ulsan Metropolitan City) and a list of village beliefs transmission status table in Busan in 2024 (= list of continuous status of village beliefs in Busan Metropolitan City).
20649.name: Village Beliefs in Korea:Ulsan Metropolitan City&Gyeongsangnam-do

2065.description:
The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Enterprise Knowledge Management types or categories that are important to most enterprises, Information Technology (IT) Organizations, IT Professionals, and Knowledge Management Professionals who support or provide services to enterprises.

A Knowledge Taxonomy is often used as a foundation for understanding the types of Knowledge that an enterprise needs to identify, measure, collect, persist, share, teach, and/or develop and improve, over time.
2065.name: Knowledge Management Taxonomy

20650.description:
Village Faith in Korea: North Jeolla Province (Polk Religion of Villages in Korea - Jeollabuk-do)

Starting in 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea has divided the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and is conducting a survey on village beliefs by region. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced and the form is changed briefly in local village communities, including large cities, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it was necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing.

In 2023, a survey of village beliefs was conducted in the Jeolla and Jeju areas. As a result, a report on village beliefs (total of 3 volumes) in ⌈ Korea was published following the Chungcheong area in 2022. This report is composed of three volumes: Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, Jeollabuk-do, and Jeju Special Self-Governing Province. In Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, a total of 49 regions, including 7 Gwangju Metropolitan City and 42 Jeollanam-do, were included. And in Jeollabuk-do, 35 regions of village beliefs were included. In addition, 40 regions of Jeju Special Self-Governing Province included village beliefs. Meanwhile, each report included a list of whether or not it was transmitted for comparison with the 2007 survey on the current status of village beliefs.
20650.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Jeollabuk-do

20651.description:
Village Faith in Korea: Jeju Special Self-Governing Province (Polk regulation of villages in Korea - Jeju-do)

Starting in 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea has divided the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and is conducting a survey on village beliefs by region. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced and the form is changed briefly in local village communities, including large cities, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it was necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing.

In 2023, a survey of village beliefs was conducted in the Jeolla and Jeju areas. As a result, a report on village beliefs (total of 3 volumes) in ⌈ Korea was published following the Chungcheong area in 2022. This report is composed of three volumes: Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, Jeollabuk-do, and Jeju Special Self-Governing Province. In Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, a total of 49 regions, including 7 Gwangju Metropolitan City and 42 Jeollanam-do, were included. And in Jeollabuk-do, 35 regions of village beliefs were included. In addition, 40 regions of Jeju Special Self-Governing Province included village beliefs. Meanwhile, each report included a list of whether or not it was transmitted for comparison with the 2007 survey on the current status of village beliefs.
20651.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Jeju-do

20652.description:
South Korea's Village Belief: South Chungcheong Province (Polk Religion of Villages in Korea - Chungcheongnam-do)

The National Folk Museum of Korea is responsible for conducting folk surveys that publicly and diachronically discover and identify the origins and transmission of folklore that make up our lives from traditional society to modern society, and at the same time, it is in charge of transmitting them. As one of these folk research projects, the whole country, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, is divided into six regions from 2022, and a village faith survey is conducted accordingly.

The first survey area in 2022 is the Chungcheon area. The investigation was urgent because the Chungcheon area underwent the biggest change in accordance with the national project of administrative-centered complex city construction.

The result of the 2022 survey on village beliefs by region is the ⌈ Korean Village Faith ⌋ (Chungcheong area) survey report (a total of three volumes). This survey report contains the contents of participatory observation and investigation of village beliefs in the Chungcheong region corresponding to Daejeon Metropolitan City, Sejong Special Self-Governing City, Chungcheongnam-do, and Chungcheongbuk-do conducted in January 2022.
20652.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Chungcheongnam-do

20653.description:
South Korea's Village Belief: Chungcheongbuk-do (Polk Religion of Villages in Korea - Chungcheongbuk-do)

The National Folk Museum of Korea is responsible for conducting folk surveys that publicly and diachronically discover and identify the origins and transmission of folklore that make up our lives from traditional society to modern society, and at the same time, it is in charge of transmitting them. As one of these folk research projects, the whole country, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, is divided into six regions from 2022, and a village faith survey is conducted accordingly.

The first survey area in 2022 is the Chungcheon area. The investigation was urgent because the Chungcheon area underwent the biggest change in accordance with the national project of administrative-centered complex city construction.

The result of the 2022 survey on village beliefs by region is the ⌈ Korean Village Faith ⌋ (Chungcheong area) survey report (a total of three volumes). This survey report contains the contents of participatory observation and investigation of village beliefs in the Chungcheong region corresponding to Daejeon Metropolitan City, Sejong Special Self-Governing City, Chungcheongnam-do, and Chungcheongbuk-do conducted in January 2022.
20653.name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Chungcheongbuk-do

20654.description: The Korean Green Classification System Guidelines (K-Taxonomy Guidelines) are guidelines for the Korean green classification system established by the Ministry of Environment in accordance with the Environmental Technology and Environmental Industry Support Act revised on April 13, 2021. The Korean green classification system can be used for green finance as a guide to define green economic activities. For example, it can be applied to projects subject to investment in green bonds in connection with the 'Korean Green Bond Guidelines' of the Ministry of Environment and the Financial Services Commission published in December 2020 to support and revitalize investment in environmental responsibility. Institutions that issue green bonds will be able to increase the trust of investors by selecting projects that correspond to true green economic activities by utilizing the Korean green classification system.
20654.name: K-Taxonomy Guidelines

20655.description:
The Korean Patent Classification (KPC) is its own patent classification system introduced in 2022 to solve the overcrowding phenomenon of prior literature in CPC classification sites and to improve the efficiency and accuracy of classification search.
Currently, advanced overseas patent offices are accelerating internationalization by establishing their own patent classification system (ex) Japan (JPO's FI, F-term) in addition to the existing IPC to support their own industries and reflect them in international patent classification.
Accordingly, in accordance with the necessity of establishing and internationalizing its own patent classification system, Korea began designing KPC codes in 2021 and introduced them in earnest in 2022.
In 2021, a total of 244 detailed KPC codes were newly established by conducting KPC code design for nine technical fields such as organic light emitting materials, quantum computers, and mRNA vaccines. In 2022, a total of 179 detailed KPC codes were newly established for 10 technical fields such as hydrogen energy, quantum cryptography, and welding jig, and in 23, 154 detailed KPC codes for 5 technical fields such as robot vacuum cleaners and surgical robots.
20655.name: Korean Patent Classification

20656.description: The HARBOR Classification System is a system classified to manage and operate ports systematically and efficiently according to the Port Act and the Enforcement Decree, and ports are largely divided into trading ports and coastal ports.
20656.name: HARBOR Classification System

20657.description: The Classification of Nuclear Materials by Grade is the class of nuclear materials subject to physical protection. Considering the potential risk, it is classified into grade I, grade II, and grade III. The requirements for protection can be found in the Enforcement Decree of the Radioactive Disaster Prevention Act (attached Table 2), the protection requirements for nuclear facilities, etc. (related to Article 16).
20657.name: Classification of Nuclear Materials by Grade

20658.description: Sign Language for Legal Termination in Administrative Procedures describes each procedure in the order in which administrative procedures are carried out, mainly used terms, and key legal terms used throughout the administrative procedures are presented in sign language, and explanations to help understand them.
20658.name: Sign Language for Legal Terminology in Administrative Procedures

20659.description: The Electronic Dictionary of Public Administration is a knowledge dictionary that accumulates and electronicizes terms related to public administration in computer storage devices and has the identity of online, administrative and policy, and mini-paper. In other words, it can increase efficiency in that it is an electronic dictionary using a computer and is in line with the society in that it deals with administration and policy. In addition, understanding is further enhanced by illuminating the background of terms, not a simple concept-oriented dictionary.
20659.name: Electronic Dictionary of Public Administration

2066.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different Categories or Types of Policies that are common to most enterprises. This Taxonomy is associated with the IT Disciplines known as Policy Management.
2066.name: Policy Taxonomy

20660.description: The Classification of Constitutional Court Case Records is classified into main case, application case, and special case in accordance with the "Rules on Receiving Constitutional Court Cases", and is organized according to the type of case. The case records are classified by the type of case and then organized according to the order of completion of the case and the case number. This system provides the criteria for ensuring the efficiency and systemicity of case management.
20660.name: Classification of Constitutional Court Case Records

20661.description: The Innovative Medical Devices Group Classification is designated after deliberation by the committee in consideration of promoting medical device research and development, improving treatment methods, and treating rare and intractable diseases in accordance with Article 20 of the Medical Devices Industry Act. Medical devices designated as innovative medical devices are valid for three years from the date of designation and can be extended through re-evaluation. The designation process will be announced by the Ministry of Health and Welfare after deliberation by the Medical Device Industry Promotion and Support Committee, and the applied innovative medical devices will be designated by the Minister of Food and Drug Safety in consultation with the Minister of Health and Welfare.
20661.name: Innovative Medical Devices Group Classification

20662.description:
The Innovative Medical Devices Group Designation System Guide is a data that explains the overall introduction of the Innovative Medical Device Group Designation System, the scope and procedure of designation, and how to apply. The main contents include the criteria and review procedures for determining the areas where the applied products are included among the detailed technology groups classified into 4* according to whether they are applicable to the innovative medical device group and the purpose of designation.

*According to the purpose of designation under Article 14 of the Enforcement Decree of the Medical Device Industry Act, it is classified into four high-tech groups, medical innovation groups, technology innovation groups, and public-interest medical groups
20662.name: Innovative Medical Devices Group Designation System Guide

20663.description:
The LIDO Category Vocabulary is a structured controlled list of terms recommended to use as values in the LIDO Category element.
Examples are human-made object or natural object.
20663.name: LIDO Terminology Category

20664.description:
The LIDO Classification Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Classification element.
The type attribute qualifies the particular kind of scheme used for the classification of an object/work, whether it is, for instance, based on object genres or subject categories.
20664.name: LIDO Terminology Classification Type

20665.description:
The LIDO Earliest Date Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Earliest Date element for the expression of the date, for instance a year or calendar date, that delimits the beginning of a date span.
The type attribute qualifies the kind of earliest date, whether it is exact or estimated.
20665.name: LIDO Terminology Earliest Date Type

20666.description:
The LIDO Repository Work Identification Number Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Repository Work Identification Number element.
The type attribute indicates the kind of custodian identification number, whether it is, for instance, an accession number or an inventory number.
20666.name: LIDO Terminology Work ID Type

20667.description:
The LIDO Vital Place Actor Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Vital Place Actor element.
The type attribute designates, for example, where a person was born, died, or is or was active; or the location where a group of persons was formed or dissolved.
20667.name: LIDO Terminology Vital Place Actor Type

20668.description:
The LIDO Vital Dates Actor Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Vital Dates Actor element.
The type attribute indicates the kind of date with respect to the biography of a person, for example birth date or death date, or the life cycle of an organization such as its founding date.
20668.name: LIDO Terminology Vital Dates Actor Type

20669.description:
The LIDO Subject Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Subject element.
The type attribute indicates the kind of subject information, whether it is, for instance, a description of a generic subject, an identification of a named individual, or an interpretation of the theme.
20669.name: LIDO Terminology Subject Type

2067.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of different Process types or categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) professionals to help identify, define, classify, structure, organize, track and understand various Processes. These Process types or categorizations are associated with the IT Discipline called Process Management.
2067.name: Process Taxonomy

20670.description:
The LIDO Rights Type Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Rights Type element for rights information being recorded.
The type attribute qualifies the kind of rights type, whether it refers to a generic kind of right, like copyright or performance rights, or is a specific rights or license statement, for instance, Rights Statements or Creative Commons Licenses.
20670.name: LIDO Terminology Rights Type Type

20671.description:
The LIDO Related Work Relationship Type Vocabulary is a hierarchically structured, controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the LIDO Related Work Relationship Type element, indicating the kind of relationship between objects/works that have a direct, important conceptual relationship with each other.
Examples are depicts, documents, or is copy of.
[Based on Cataloging Cultural Objects]
20671.name: LIDO Terminology Related Work Relationship Type

20672.description:
The LIDO Record Metadata Information Set Type-Vocabulary is a structured controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the Record Metadata Information Set element.
The type attribute designates the scope of metadata information, presentation information or service information contained in the set.
20672.name: LIDO Terminology Record Metadata Information Set Type

20673.description: The LIDO Preference Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the pref attribute indicating the preference role of a term, an appellation value, an identifier, or a resource set.
20673.name: LIDO Terminology Preference

20674.description:
The LIDO Period/Style Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the Period/Style element.
The type attribute qualifies the particular kind of period/style information, such as style, period, or movement. Examples may be neolithic for a period, impressionist for a style, or cubism for a movement.
[Based on CDWA "Styles/Periods/Groups/Movements"]
LIDO Terminology (2015-)
20674.name: LIDO Terminology Period Name Type

20675.description:
The LIDO Object/Work Type Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Object/Work Type element.
The type attribute qualifies the aspect or characteristic of division by which the Object/Work Type is grouped. Values for this attribute are commonly referred to as "guide terms" or "node labels".
Examples may include aspects like by form, by function, by material or technique, or by subject.
20675.name: LIDO Terminology Object/Work Type Type

20676.description: The LIDO Object Type Vocabulary is a structured controlled list of terms recommended to use as values in the LIDO Object Type element, specifying the particular kind of object being in some way associated with the object/work that is the focus of the record.
20676.name: LIDO Terminology Object Type

20677.description:
The LIDO Object Measurements Set Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Object Measurements Set element.
The type attribute qualifies whether the measurements given are features of the object proper or object requirements for handling the object, for instance, the maximum temperature variation.
20677.name: LIDO Terminology Object Measurements Set Type

20678.description:
The LIDO Object Description Set Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Object Description Set element.
The type attribute qualifies the particular kind of the descriptive note, whether it is, for example, the description of the acquisition, an exhibition, or the provenance of the object or work.
20678.name: LIDO Terminology Object Description Set Type

20679.description:
The LIDO Nationality Actor Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Nationality Actor element.
The type attribute qualifies the particular kind of actor affiliation, such as to a country, culture, or ethnic group.
20679.name: LIDO Terminology Nationality Actor Type

2068.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of different Record types or categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) professionals in order to help define, structure, organize, track and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge. These Record types or categorizations are associated with the IT Discipline called Records Management and its related processes.
2068.name: Records Taxonomy

20680.description:
The LIDO Latest Date Type-Vocabulary is acontrolled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Latest Date element, expressing the date, for instance a year or calendar date, that delimits the end of a date span.
The type attribute qualifies the kind of latest date, whether it is exact or estimated.
20680.name: LIDO Terminology Latest Date Type

20681.description:
The LIDO Gender Actor Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Gender Actor element, indicating the sex assigned at birth or the gender identity of an actor.
The type attribute qualifies whether the indexing term refers to sex or gender generally, or to sex as a biological characteristic or gender as a social or cultural distinction.
20681.name: LIDO Terminology Gender Actor Type

20682.description:
The LIDO Event Place Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Event Place element.
The type attribute qualifies the place according to its role or function in the context of an event, whether it is a place of discovery, a point of destination, or a point of origin.
20682.name: LIDO Terminology Event Place Type

20683.description:
The LIDO Event Description Set Type-Vocabulary is a controlled list of terms recommended to use as values for the type attribute of the LIDO Event Description Set element.
The type attribute qualifies the particular kind of the descriptive note, whether it is, for example, the description of an acquisition or an exhibition event.
20683.name: LIDO Terminology Event Description Set Type

2069.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of different Records Management types or categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) professionals in order to help define, structure, organize, track and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge. These Record Management types or categorizations are associated with the IT Discipline called Records Management and all of its related processes and solutions. They also help to highlight the importance and complexity of Records Management.
2069.name: Records Management Taxonomy

207.description: The version presented by the TESAURO ISOC DE PSICOLOGIA, like the previous one, can be improved, since the thesaurus, although it is a controlled language, has to reflect the natural language of a discipline and, therefore, must incorporate the terms This issue, like the previous one, is considered to be a very useful tool for all Documentation Centers and Libraries specializing in Psychology or related sciences .
207.name: ISOC Psychology Thesaurus

2070.description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of different Roadmap types or categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) professionals, their organizations and the business they support, in order to help with the definition and understanding of Work and Delivery that is critical to the implementation and oversight of Strategy. These Roadmap types or categorizations are associated with the IT Discipline called Roadmap Management and its related processes, and they represent the inventory of all Roadmaps that mature enterprises strive to define and maintain, regularly.
2070.name: Roadmap Taxonomy

2071.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different Service Types or Categories that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations, professionals and their business clients to help define, deploy and manage the many different Services that are used to facilitate Work Management or Service Management solutions.
2071.name: Service Taxonomy

2072.description:
The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of the many different key Taxonomy types or categorizations that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge. Such a Taxonomy is often used as a foundation for activities like data modeling (i.e. the design, definition and development of other Taxonomies and Ontologies). Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.

Note: Each of these Taxonomy types or categorizations is directly aligned with the specific form of Taxonomy Management.
2072.name: Taxonomy Taxonomy

2073.description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different Unique Identifier Types that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals (especially Data professionals) to help create Data Solutions that allow unique identification of instances of Data Entities or Data Items. This Taxonomy is associated with the IT Disciplines known as Unique Identifier Management and Data Management.
2073.name: Unique Identifier (ID) Taxonomy

2074.description: The IF4IT’s IT Glossary is intended to be a centralized, thorough, public and freely available repository of Information Technology 'Operations' (or 'Operational') terms. By Operations/Operational we mean that these terms address how Information Technology resources 'work' and the concepts they need to perform their work. The glossary consists of thousands of of terms that are consistent with how IT leaders lead and how IT workers work, across all industries. We’re proud of the fact that the IF4IT Glossary is the most thorough operations glossary in the world and that it is constantly growing at a rate that outpaces any other glossary source that is available to the IT community.
2074.name: Information Technology Glossary of Terms and Phrases

2075.description: A common language that conveys the complex reality of current social and cultural values–ethical, aesthetic, scientific and technological–remains a constant concern for those in charge of transmitting a message to society, particularly in the field of museology. In this context, the International Committee of ICOM for Museology (ICOFOM) developed the booklet “Key Concepts of Museology”, an avant-première of the complete Dictionary of Museology, a reference tool that will provide museum professionals worldwide with a common language.
